Item Title: Hey pote, passe-moi une capote! Toujour avec un gel à base d'eau [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Agence française de lutte contre le Sida|~|Aides (Association)

Title: Hey pote, passe-moi une capote! Toujour avec un gel à base d'eau [inscribed]

The poster targets young gay men and encourages the use of condoms and water-based lubricants to prevent the transmission of AIDS.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR055.
Alternate Title.translated: Hey pal, pass me a condom! Always with a water-based lubricant

Item Title: Sida Info Service : nous avons le devoir de réponse [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Sida Info Service : nous avons le devoir de réponse [inscribed]
Description.note: Eight black and white portraits: interracial couple; woman with her hair tied back wearing a cardigan; man wearing a black sports coat; gay male couple; man wearing a checkered oxford; middle aged couple; woman wearing a jean-jacket; man wearing a leather jacket with a hoop earring in one ear and a stud in the other. Poster provides the phone number for a 24-hour AIDS hotline, Sida Info Service, and suggests it as a resource for questions about HIV and AIDS.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR056.|~|Date on back of poster, 1995, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS Info Service : we have a duty to respond

Item Title: Et le préservatif, vous attendez quoi pour en parler? [inscribed]

Title: Et le préservatif, vous attendez quoi pour en parler? [inscribed]

Additional text indicates that they are talking about the relationship of individual countries to the European Union. Poster suggests that it is more important to talk about condoms and safe sex.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR058.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Virus du sida ne se transmet pas en pénétrant dans le bureau d'une collègue [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Virus du sida ne se transmet pas en pénétrant dans le bureau d'une collègue [inscribed]
Description.note: Depicts a door handle covered by a condom. Poster addresses a misperception about the transmission of the AIDS virus. Poster suggests through the image (suggestive representation of a penis) and text (penetrating) the actual mode of transmission of the AIDS virus through sex, and the importance of using a condom as protection.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR059.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS virus is not transmitted by penetrating the office of a female colleague

Item Title: Virus du sida ne se transmet pas en suçant le stylo d'un collègue [inscribed]

Title: Virus du sida ne se transmet pas en suçant le stylo d'un collègue [inscribed]

Poster suggests through the images (suggestive representations of penises) and text (sucking) the actual mode of transmission of the AIDS virus through sex, and the importance of using a condom as protection.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR060.
Alternate Title.descriptive: AIDS virus is not transmitted by sucking a colleague's pen

Alternate Title.descriptive: AIDS virus is not trasmitted by using the telephone receiver of a colleague

Item Title: Vous avez des doutes... Des reponses pour y voir plus clair [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Vous avez des doutes... Des reponses pour y voir plus clair [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: 0 8000 840 800, Sida Info Service.

It promotes the Sida Info Service in France which provides 24/7 information services. A red telephone cord in the shape of an AIDS ribbon is placed on top of the hotline number. The Services are confidential, anonymous, and free.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR062.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Who will make war against AIDS? [inscribed]

Item Title: Images pour la lutte contre le SIDA: Journee Mondiale du SIDA 1er Decembre 1993 [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: France. Ministère de la culture et de la communication
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Images pour la lutte contre le SIDA: Journee Mondiale du SIDA 1er Decembre 1993 [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Une exposition de 35 images d'artistes, diffusee simultanement a 1.000 ex. et adaptee a tous les lieux de vie, de sante, d'etudes, de travail et de loisirs de la population.
Description.note: Against the background of a globe, poster lists the names of 35 international artists who were commissioned to create posters for a national poster campaign against AIDS. A banner superimposed on the globe reads "Vous êtes ici." Additional poster text concerns an exhibition of these posters.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR071.
Alternate Title.translated: Images for the fight against AIDS: World AIDS Day December 1 1993

Item Title: Ceci ne transmet pas le virus du sida [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Caisse régionale d'assurance maladie de Bourgogne-Franche-Comté
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Ceci ne transmet pas le virus du sida [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Captions: foule, poignées de mains; animaux domestiques et moustiques; piscine; lessive ménagère, laveries automatiques; douches - toilettes; lieu de travail; enfants à l'ecole; fontaines publiques; visites à l'hôpital; couverts, nourriture, restaurants...
Description.note: Poster presents a sequence of illustrations which show how HIV cannot be transmitted: man shaking hands; man laying on a couch with his cat and swatting a fly; man on a ladder in a pool wearing a swim cap with a fish next to him; man covered in soap suds standing next to a hanger and washing machine; man exiting a public restroom; man holding a hammer jumping to reach a nail; two children playing with blocks; man drinking from a public water fountain; man running with flowers in his hand for a hospital visit; man sitting at a table with a plate in front of him holding a large knife and fork; man and woman hugging and kissing; man surrounded by two large telephone receivers; doctor examining a patient; man donating blood.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR072.|~|Date on back of poster, 2000, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: This does not transmit the AIDS virus

Item Title: Quand on est le seul contraceptif qui protège du sida et des MST, c'est normal de rougir un peu [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Comité français d'éducation pour la santé|~|Institut national de prévention et d'éducation pour la santé (France)
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: France. Ministère de l'emploi et de la solidarité
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Quand on est le seul contraceptif qui protège du sida et des MST, c'est normal de rougir un peu [inscribed]
Description.note: Part of AIDS campaign: Sida. Aujourd'hui, on peut faire beaucoup. Mas rien sans vous. [AIDS. Today, we can do a lot. But nothing without you]|~|Upper half of the poster depicts a reddish-pink condom on a green background, with the implication that it is blushing at its own accomplishments.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR073.
Alternate Title.translated: When you are the only contraceptive that protects against AIDS and sexually transmitted diseases, it's only natural to blush
Alternate Title.other: Sida. Aujourd'hui, on peut faire beaucoup. Mas rien sans vous

Item Title: Préservatif est assez résistant pour s'allonger de 650%. C'est un peu la différence entre un préservatif et vous [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Comité français d'éducation pour la santé|~|France. Secrétariat d'Etat à la santé et à l'action sociale.
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Préservatif est assez résistant pour s'allonger de 650%. C'est un peu la différence entre un préservatif et vous [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: SIDA Info service:0 800 840 800.|~|Additional poster text: Cette campagne de prévention et d'information est réalisée à l'initiative du
Description.note: Part of campaign: "Sida. Aujourd'hui, on peut faire beaucoup. Mas rien san vous." [AIDS. Today, we can do a lot. But nothing without you]|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR074.|~|A naked man stands looking down at himself, against a pink background. A darker pink banner containing the poster title hides him from the waist down. The campaign makes fun of the reasons some give for not using condoms.
Alternate Title.translated: Condom is resistant enough to get longer by 650%. That is the difference between a condom and you
Alternate Title.other: Sida. Aujourd'hui, on peut faire beaucoup. Mas rien san vous

Item Title: Si vous ne trouvez pas de préservatif a votre taille, vous êtes un éléphant [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: France. Ministère de l'emploi et de la solidarité|~|France. Secrétariat d'Etat à la santé|~|Institut national de prévention et d'éducation pour la santé (France)
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Comité français d'éducation pour la santé
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Si vous ne trouvez pas de préservatif a votre taille, vous êtes un éléphant [inscribed]
Description.note: Poster uses image, top half is a photograph of the feet of an elephant, and text to encourage men to use condoms to prevent the transmission of the HIV virus. Telephone number for Sida Info Service, a hotline in France, is provided.|~|Part of the "Sida. Aujourd'hui, on peut faire beaucoup. Mas rien san vous" campaign. [AIDS. Today, we can do a lot. But nothing without you]|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR075.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: If you cannot find condoms in your size, you are an elephant
Alternate Title.other: Sida. Aujourd'hui, on peut faire beaucoup. Mas rien san vous

Item Title: Ce qu'il y a de plus facile dans la brouette japonaise et la toupie enchantée, c'est de mettre un préservatif [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Comité français d'éducation pour la santé
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: France. Ministère de l'emploi et de la solidarité
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Ce qu'il y a de plus facile dans la brouette japonaise et la toupie enchantée, c'est de mettre un préservatif [inscribed]
Description.note: Part of the AIDS campaign: "Sida. Aujourd'hui, on peut faire beaucoup. Mais rien sans vous." [AIDS. Today, we can do a lot. But nothing without you]|~|The upper half of the poster is a mosaic depicting a scene from the "Kama sutra," an East Indian work on sex instruction. The center of the mosaic shows a man and woman sitting on the floor facing each other, arms and legs intertwined, having sexual intercourse.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR076.
Alternate Title.translated: Easiest thing about using a position from the Kama Sutra is putting on a condom
Alternate Title.other: Sida. Aujourd'hui, on peut faire beaucoup. Mais rien sans vous.

Item Title: Prévention: l'affaire de chachun [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Agence française de lutte contre le Sida
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Prévention: l'affaire de chachun [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Sida info service au 05 36 66 36, 7 jours sur 7, 24 heures sur 24, vous écoute, vous informe, vous oriente et vous soutient. [AIDS Info Service at 05 36 66 36, 7 days a week, 24 hours a day, listens to you, informs you, directs you and supports you.]
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR077.|~|Poster consists of black and white text on a background ranging from pink to lilac. Text promotes HIV testing as a matter of individual and social responsibility, and promotes policies of social integration for HIV-positive persons.
Alternate Title.descriptive: Prevention: everybody's business

Item Title: Dépistage, ça va de soi-même [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Agence française de lutte contre le Sida
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Dépistage, ça va de soi-même [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Faire volontairement un test de dépistage du VIH est un comportement responsable. En France, le test n'est pas obligatoire sauf à l'occasion des dons de sang, de sperme ou d'organes. On ne peut donc pas l'exiger de vous. [Voluntarily taking an HIV test is responsible behavior. In France, the test isn't mandatory except when donating blood, sperm or organs. It is not otherwise required of you.]
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR078.|~|Poster consists of black and white text on an orange background. Text promotes HIV testing as a matter of individual responsibility, and gives information about when an HIV test is, or is not, obligatory.
Alternate Title.translated: HIV testing, a natural solution

Item Title: Avec mes œillères, je positive... [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Avec mes œillères, je positive... [inscribed]
Description.note: Poster uses a photograph of an eyeball placed in the center of the poster, splitting the text to the sides to suggest the idea of someone with blinders on. In red letters, the name "Observatoire international des prisons," a French organization working for the defense of rights of prisoners, is repeated throughout the text. Text lists facts about conditions of prisons, treatment of prisoners, and human rights violations around the world.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR080.
Alternate Title.translated: With blinders on, I am ok...

Item Title: Poster of penis as a serpent [descriptive]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Poster of penis as a serpent [descriptive]
Description.note: Graphic depiction of a penis with a forked tongue as a symbolic representation of "the serpent." Poster suggests the succumbing to the temptation of (unprotected?) sex poses a potentially fatal risk of contracting AIDS.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR081.|~|Date on back of poster, 2002, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Poster of naked woman with pubic hair shaped like a coffin [descriptive]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Poster of naked woman with pubic hair shaped like a coffin [descriptive]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Les femmes ont trois fois plus des risques d'attraper le SIDA.|~|Translated poster text: Women are three times more at risk of contracting the AIDS virus.
Description.note: Graphic depiction of a nude woman's pelvic area with pubic hair shaved in the shape of a coffin. Poster suggests (unprotected?) sexual intercourse is a potentially fatal risk for the contraction of the AIDS virus.|~|Part of "Protégez-vous" campaign.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR082.|~|Date on back of poster, 2002, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.inscribed: Naked woman with pubic hair shaped like a coffin

Item Title: Help & fly [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Help & fly [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Die Benefizaktion von LTU International Airways anlässlich des 14. Welt-AIDS-Tages am 1. Dezember 2001 zugunsten der AIDS-Hilfe Düsseldorf.
Description.note: White text on orange background. Small white AIDS ribbon appears in middle. Poster advertises a flight organized as a fundraiser sponsored by LTU International Airways, to benefit the organization AIDS-Hilfe Düsseldorf. Flight took place in Düsseldorf, Germany. Poster chiefly in German; only title is in English. Fundraiser held in honor of 14th World AIDS Day, Dec. 1, 2001.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW002.

Item Title: Wichtigste Über AIDS [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Wichtigste Über AIDS [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional text: Das Wichtigste über AIDS steht auf diesem Plakat. Mehr über die Krankheit, ihren Verlauf und über weitere Themen finden Sie in der Broschüre "Was jede/r über AIDS wissen sollte". Sie beantwortet Ihnen die wichtigsten Fragen. Die Broschüre können Sie bei der Bundeszentrale für gesundheitliche Aufklärung, 51101 Köln, anfordern. [The most important information on AIDS is covered on this poster. It covers the illness and its process as well as topics " which we should know about AIDS." It answers your most important questions. The pamphlet can be requested at the Federal Center for Health Education.]
Description.note: Poster shows two squares, one is of how the AIDS disease can be transmitted and the other is of ways that the disease cannot be transmitted. Logo of "Gib AIDS keine chance," Give AIDS no chance, represents a campaign for the federal center of health clearing-up.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW033.|~|Date on back of poster, 1995, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Most important (information) about AIDS

Item Title: Condoms protect against HIV not Syphilis
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Condoms protect against HIV not Syphilis
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: info+ Bei Menschen mit HIV gelten besondere Dosierungs- empfehlungen für die Syphilis-behandlung, außerdem schreitet bei ihnen eine unbehandelte infektion schneller fort- bei einer Syphilisdiagnose ist daher ein HIV-Test sinnvoll. [For people with HIV, special dosage is recommended to treat Syphilis. It is a step closer to treating the infection quickly. When diagnosed with Syphilis, an HIV test is useful.]|~|Additional poster text: Kondome schützen vor HIV. Bei Syphilis bieten sie allerdings keinen 100%igen Schutz. Frage bei Haut- und Schleimhautveränderungen einen Arzt deines Vertrauens und lass dichregelmäßig untersuchen, denn eine Syphilis wird oft nicht bemerkt. Zudem erhöht eine unbehandelte infektion das HIV-Übertragungsrisiko. [Condoms protect against HIV. With Syphilis they do not offer 100% protection. Ask questions about skin and mucous membranes to a physician whom you are comfortable with, and go for a regular checkup as Syphilis is often unnoticed. Besides, an untreated infection increases the HIV transmission risk.
Description.note: Poster shows a topless male figure standing in the dark. Because symptoms of Syphilis are unnoticed, it is similar to when a person is left in the dark.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW040.|~|Date on back of poster, 2004, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Title: AIDS: Verhütungsmöglichkeiten der HIV-Infektion
Description.inscription: AIDS ist eine schwere, heute noch nich heilbare Erkrankung. Vor den Infektion kann man sich aber leicht schützen. [AIDS is a serious condition with as yet no known cure. You can, however, protect yourself easily from infection.]|~|Verzicht auf walhlose Sexualkontakte; Bei Ungewissheit Kondome benutzen; Kein Austausch von Injektionsnadeln. [Avoid indiscriminate sexual contact; When in doubt use a condom; No exchange of hypodermic needles.]
Description.note: Drawings next to each instructional caption show (in order): a man and a woman with their arms around one another; two men having anal sex, two men having oral sex, and a condom; two men exchanging hypodermic needle syringes.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Item Title: Welt-AIDS-Tag 1. Dezember

Title: Welt-AIDS-Tag 1. Dezember
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Gemeinsame Rechte -- Gemeinsame Verantwortung [Mutual rights -- Mutual responsibility] (theme of World AIDS Day in 1995)|~|Additional poster text: Die Rote Schleife steht für Solidarität mit Menschen, die von AIDS betroffen sind. Zeigen Sie Anteilnahme und Engagement; Unterstützen Sie mit einter Spende die AIDS-Stiftungen und die Deutsche AIDS-Hilfe (Konto 4004 Stichwort: Welt-AIDS-Tag, bei allen Geldinstituten) oder andere Initiativen, die sich für Menschen mit HIV und AIDS einsetzen. [The red ribbon stands for solidarity with those afflicted with AIDS. Show your participation and commitment: lend your support by donating to AIDS charities and the Deutsche AIDS-Hilfe. (Account 4004, Keyword: Welt-AIDS-Tag, at any banking institution) or to any other initiatives on behalf of those afflicted with AIDS and HIV.]
Description.note: Photograph of a red ribbon badge, which is the symbol of solidary and support for all people suffering with AIDS and HIV. World AIDS Day began in 1988, and has been held every year since, always on December 1.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW092.
Alternate Title.translated: World AIDS Day, 1 December

Item Title: Urlaub von der Treue is das Ende der Sicherheit
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Urlaub von der Treue is das Ende der Sicherheit
Description.inscription: Die Bundeszentrale für gesundheitliche Aufklärung informiert ... [The Center for Health Information advises ...]|~|AIDS bekommt man nicht wie einen Schnupfen. Anstecken kann man sich bei ungeschütztem Sex mit unbekannten Partnern. Deshalb gilt im Urlaub, wie überall: Partnerschaftliche Treue ist der Beste Schutz vor AIDS. Wenn Sie noch Fragen haben, rufen Sie an: 0221/892031 [You don't get AIDS like you do a cold. You can be infected by having unprotected sex with strangers. So when on vacation, as always: Fidelity is the best protection against AIDS. For more information, call: 0221/892031]
Description.note: Photograph depicting a man with his arm around one woman, turning to look suggestively at another woman. They are both holding cocktails and she appears to be inviting his attention.|~|Part of the public AIDS campaign in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW105.
Alternate Title.translated: A vacation from fidelity is the end of security

Item Title: Nicht jede Verbindung ist eine feste
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nicht jede Verbindung ist eine feste
Description.note: Depicts a young woman on the telephone, one hand caressing the phone cord. She is wearing a cocktail dress and has a string of pearls around her neck. The poster text "eine Feste Verbindung" is being used in reference to a clear telephone connection, which relates directly to the poster's graphic. The phrase can also be interpreted as "a permanent connection," as in a permanent relationship with another person. The poster is then suggesting that not all relationships are free of "static" or are permanent, indicating that no one should be taking chances with a sexual partner. Protection should always be used.|~|Part of the public AIDS campaign in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance].|~|Additional poster text: Dem Leben zuliebe.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW126.
Alternate Title.translated: Not every connection is a clear one

The words "dream-team" suggest that the heart, representing love, and the condom, representing safe sex, are the perfect team to prevent AIDS transmission during sex.|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW131.

Item Title: Wenn alle sich schützen, hat AIDS keine Chance

Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Wenn alle sich schützen, hat AIDS keine Chance
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: AIDS, das vermeidbare Risiko [AIDS, the avoidable risk]... Der Senator für Gesundheit und Soziales. Kondome vermindern die AIDS-Ansteckungs-Gefahr. Automatische Auskunft [The Senator for Health and Social Affairs. Condoms lessen the danger of AIDS infection].
Description.note: Black text on a white background, with the word "AIDS" in larger font, standing out by being placed within a rectangular red background. The message is stark and clear, just as the text on the poster suggests: AIDS can be stopped when people use protection.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW133.
Alternate Title.translated: When everyone protects themselves, AIDS doesn't have a chance

Item Title: Love island
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Love island
Description.note: Cartoon of a naked woman and a naked man on a desert island. They are kissing each other, and heart balloons are floating over their heads. They are seated near a palm tree, which boasts colorful condoms for fronds.|~|Part of the public AIDS campaign in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW134.

Item Title: Mann/Mann
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Mann/Mann
Description.note: This "Steck" cartoon depicts two naked men with their arms around each other, seated on a hilltop, smiling. Snow is falling around them. However, they are sitting under the "protection" of a condom, which is keeping them safe from the snowfall, and safe from the darkness, as light is eminating down from the condom above them. Since the snowflakes are suggestive of sperm, the two men can be thought of as being kept safe from the transmission of AIDS through the use of a condom.|~|Part of the public AIDS campaign in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW135.
Alternate Title.translated: Man man

Item Title: Mann/Frau

Title: Mann/Frau
Description.note: This "Steck" cartoon depicts a naked woman and a naked man, with their arms around each other, seated on a hilltop, gazing upward with a started look on their faces. Snow is falling around them, but they are sitting under the "protection" of a condom, which is keeping them safe from the snowfall, and safe from the darkness, as light is eminating down from the condom above. Since the snowflakes can be suggestive of sperm, the couple can be thought of as being kept safe from the transmission of AIDS through the use of a condom.|~|Part of the public AIDS campaign in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW136.
Alternate Title.descriptive: Man woman

Item Title: AIDS: Das kommt in den besten Familien vor
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Projekt - PR
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: AIDS: Das kommt in den besten Familien vor
Description.note: Poster is a brochure depicting toys and an article explaining that AIDS does not discriminate between classes and ages. Article brings up AIDS awareness and the social stigma of somone who is infected.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW137.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS: it happens in the best of families

Item Title: Aids und Familie
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Aids und Familie
Description.note: Poster has a short story for the words,Worries,  Hope, Memories, Support, Gossip. For worries, Ina is an infected single mother who worries about the care of her daughter when she dies. For hope, Margot and Peter have taken on four-year old Tobias whose parents died of AIDS, they hope there will be a cure soon. For memories, Marianne lost both her sons to AIDS, she is having a difficult time adjusting, even though they died some time ago. For support, Jorge was accompanied by his friend Marcus when Jorge found out he had AIDS; Marcus is supportive, non-judgmental and not HIV-infected. For gossip, Kai lives in a small town, the last time his brother, Manfred, visited his family, they were shocked at his sickly appearance. His parents worry about what the neighbors are thinking. Poster sums up their stories, bringing up issues and questions. AIDS is a big challenge to those infected and their friends and families. They're dealing with the situation. How to cope with the terminally ill. A loved one will die, they wonder why it happened to them and how they can help.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW137b.
Alternate Title.descriptive: AIDS and the familiy

Item Title: AIDS ist auch Männersache
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: AIDS ist auch Männersache
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Geshundeit. Sexualität. Familie. Prävention. Kondome. Weltaidstag 1. Dezember [Health. Sexuality. Family. Prevention. Condoms. World AIDS Day, December 1].
Description.note: The poster is part of a published brochure entitled "AIDS ist auch Männersache." Divided by color into quadrants, the poster features four pictures: condoms (on an orange background), a man's hand holding a small barbell (on a blue background), an open lipstick container (on a pink background), and four Teddy bears (on a green background). In the lower right corner, a small AIDS ribbon appears next to the logo for the German anti-AIDS campaign slogan.|~|Part of the public AIDS campaign in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW138.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS is also an issue for men

Item Title: Warum verlangt Leda das von mir?
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Communicable diseases--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Birth control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Warum verlangt Leda das von mir?
Description.note: Poster is a comical cartoon drawing of a swan, with a condom on its beak, lamenting "Why does Leda expect me to do this?" The obvious reference is to the classical Greek myth, "Leda and the Swan," in which Zeus transforms himself into a Swan in order to lay with Leda (and impregnate her). The condom symbolizes protection against pregnancy, and could also be considered a symbol of protection against AIDS and sexually transmitted diseases.|~|Part of the public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance]|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW139.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Why does Leda expect me to do this?

He is looking over at a jar of unrolled condoms of all shapes and sizes. There is a sign offering them for sale at half price. The pharmacist is standing behind the counter, also looking at the jar.
Description.note: Part of the public AIDS campaign in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance]|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW140.|~|Date on back of poster, 1995, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Title: Seitensprung? Mach's mit

Title: Ohne viel Worte : Alles was geil und sicher ist : Safer Sex

Two men are positioned together, one is seated on the railing of the bridge. He is wearing a "wife-beater" T-shirt, jeans, and boots. The second man is standing near him, his arm out streached, and hand holding the bridge support above. This man is wearing a leather vest with no shirt, leather pants, boots, and a leather cap adorned with a chain. The third man stands in the shadows, gazing to the same side as the couple, but not looking directly at them. The poster text infers that safe sex is "cool."|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW144.|~|Date on back of poster, 2004, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Freunde. Jungs. Mädchen. Clique. Disco...
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences

Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Mädchen. Kino. Anfassen. Zelt. Dusche. Sport. Jungs. Party. Jungs. Mädchen. Gefühl. Jungs. Jungs [Girls. Movie theater. Touching. Tent. Shower. Sports. Boys. Party. Boys. Girls. Feelings. Boys. Boys]
Description.note: Depicts the heads and torsos of two young men, one leaning back to look into the eyes of the other positioned slightly behind him. Both are smiling. Each word of the poster text is placed on top of a pastel-colored oval, arranged in angled rows over the bottom third of the poster. The words suggest places and activities which appeal to both young men and women. These same places, emotions, and activities could be associated with sexual encounters and relationships between both gay and straight couples.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW147.
Alternate Title.translated: Friends. Boys. Girls. Clique. Disco...

Title: Mein Freund ist positiv. Ich liebe Ihn.
Description.note: Depicts two mustached men, both shirtless, one standing behind the other. The man in the back, considerably older than the man in the front, has one arm wrapped around the younger man's chest. His other arm is reaching up, his hand clasping the younger man's head. The man in the foreground is posed with one hand grabbing his own belt buckle, his other hand disappearing between his and his lover's body. Both are somberly gazing at the camera.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW148.|~|Date on back of poster, 1995, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Lust. Natur. Sicher
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Lust. Natur. Sicher
Description.note: Poster depicts two young men standing in front of a fountain-like structure. They are gazing intently at each other, while the man on the left is in the process of pulling at the unbuckled pants of the other young man, whose underwear is exposed. The background is classic, beautiful and romanesque, but is slightly out of focus. The camera is clearly accentuating the actions of the young men, and is suggestive of the sexual activity that is about to take place. The poster text suggests that feelings of lust are natural and beautiful, and that the use of protection should be considered to be a natural part of sex.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW149.
Alternate Title.translated: Lust. Nature. Safe

Item Title: Hart oder zart. Das ist nicht die Frage
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Hart oder zart. Das ist nicht die Frage
Description.note: Poster depicts a scene from a park in which two male couples are involved in sexual encounters. In the foreground, a man naked from the waist up is handcuffed to a railing. Another man is standing behind him, leaning down, and pinching his nipples. In the background, leaning on the wall of a building, is another couple making out. Next to the couple in the foreground is another handcuffed wrist, but the image is cut off by the edge of the poster. The text of the poster suggests that how one prefers to have sex is not the problem. AIDS is transmitted by not using appropriate protection.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW150.
Alternate Title.translated: Rough or gentle. That's not the question

The top two sections are graphic renderings of a flower and a bisected apple. The bottom left section contains another flower and a butterly lies over the bottom of the poster. Red AIDS ribbon placed at end of text.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW170.

Item Title: Informier dich

Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control

Title: Vergolde deinen Schwanz

The blue box partially holds the text, a yellow box is a drawing of a man's head, a red box has a drawing of a naked man with an erect penis and a gray box partially contains a drawing of a man's suited arm and hand holding a condom.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW172.
Alternate Title.translated: Gild your dick

Item Title: Salomé's 1988 painting Reflexion/Reaktion II
Subject.conceptTopic: Compassion|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome|~|Solidarity|~|Social networks|~|Care of persons|~|AIDS (Disease)--Patients--Family relationships|~|Grief
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Salomé's 1988 painting Reflexion/Reaktion II
Description.inscription: Additional text: Verzweiflung und Schweigen helfen nicht. Wir wollen kein Mitleid, sondern Unterstützung und Hilfe, wenn wir sie brauchen. Solidarität ist gefragt, nicht nur in Krisensituationen.|~|Translation: Despair and silence don't help. We don't want to be heartless, but support and help when you need it. Solidarity is required, not only in crisis situations.
Description.note: Poster reproduces the painting Reflexion/Reaktion II created by Salomé 1988 after his friend died from AIDS. The painting shows four bald men in different colored shirts and blue pants standing around a fifth man, who is naked and seated. One of the standing men is counseling the seated man, the others are thinking and reacting.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW173.|~|Date on back of poster, 2004, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Title: Safer use - gut für dich und andere - nicht nur wegen HIV und Hep--
Description.inscription: Teilen ist immer ein Risiko.  Für jeden Druck die eigene sterile Spritze und Nadel.
Description.note: Images of unsafe and safe methods of loading hypodermic needles.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW174.|~|Date on back of poster, 2004, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Safer use - good for you and others - not only against HIV and Hepatitis.

Item Title: Es gibt Dinge... die darf man nicht vergessen [inscribed].
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Es gibt Dinge... die darf man nicht vergessen [inscribed].
Description.inscription: Auch heute ist Aids ein grosses Problem.  Es bleibt eine tödlich Krankheit, für die es keine Schutzimpfung oder Heilung gibt.  Medikamente können den Ausbruch von Aids nach einer HIV-Ansteckung allerdings verzögern.
Description.note: Part of the Gib AIDS keine Chance campaign.  Image of a Dalmatian chained to a lightpost in the middle of a desert and sand dunes with the sand tinted red.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW177.|~|Poster number GW246 has the same image but different text.
Alternate Title.translated: There are things one should never forget.

Item Title: Männer stellen sich der Verantwortung.
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Männer stellen sich der Verantwortung.
Description.note: Depiction of a man and woman in dressy clothes meeting for a date.  He offers her flowers and is wearing two pins.  The first is a red AIDS ribbon.  The second says Safe Sex and has a purple condom encased in a portion hanging from the pin.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW178.
Alternate Title.translated: Men, take on responsibility.

Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW179.

Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW180.

Description.inscription: Kondome schützen vor Schwangerschaft sowie vor HIV und anderen sexuell übertragbaren Krankheiten.

Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW181.|~|Date on back of poster, 2003, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Jahren leben geben.

Title: Jahren leben geben.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW182.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Mut braucht unter stützung.
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Deutsche AIDS-Hilfe e.V.
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Mut braucht unter stützung.
Description.inscription: HIV positiv.  Es kann sein, dass dir manchmal alles über den Kopf wächst.  Dann kostet es viel Kraft, nicht aufzugeben.  Anderen Frauen geht es genauso.  Miteinander reden, gemeinsam etwas unternehmen macht Mut.  Und Spass!  Es gibt viele Angebote für positive Frauen: Selbsthilfegruppen, Freizeitaktivitäten, Gesprächstreffs.  Die Mitarbeiterinnen der AIDS-Hilfen können Dir sagen, wo du sie findest.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW183.

Item Title: Safer sex
Subject.descriptiveTopic: Anal sex|~|Oral sex|~|Gay men|~|Kissing|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control

Title: Safer sex
Description.inscription: Additional text: Ficken mit Kondom; Küssen ist Safe; Blasen ohne abspritzen.
Description.note: Across the top of the poster the words "Safer sex" are spelled out in American Sign language. Depicts a pair of men having anal sex, kissing and having oral sex. The captions inform how to perform these acts safely to prevent AIDS transmission.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW184.

Item Title: Ausgrenzung abwehren.

Title: Ausgrenzung abwehren.
Description.inscription: Live and let live.|~|Welt AIDS Tag 2003
Description.note: Depicts four members of the FC Bayern München: Willy Sagnol (France), Owen Hargreaves (England), Sammy Kuffour (Ghana), and Robert Kovac (Croatia).|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW185.

Item Title: Er is Kollege, Nachbar, Vereinsmitglied, Liebhaber. Er ist schwul. Er hat weniger Rechte
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Er is Kollege, Nachbar, Vereinsmitglied, Liebhaber. Er ist schwul. Er hat weniger Rechte
Description.note: Depicts a man in his office, at a pool, out in a neighborhood and at a bar. The man is depicted in everyday settings, emphasizing the fact that being gay doesn't make a person different. Still, gays are not afforded the same rights as straight people in society.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW186.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: He is a colleague, neighbor, club member, lover. He is gay. He has fewer rights

Item Title: Sex Spass überraschung...?
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Sexually transmitted diseases--Prevention|~|Health education|~|Promiscuity
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Sex Spass überraschung...?
Description.inscription: Additional text: Geschlechtskrankheiten sind in kommen. Benutze Kondome. Sie verringern das Ansteckungsrisiko-schützen aber nicht völlig. Achte auf deinen Körper. Bei Veränderungen frage einen Arzt Deines Vertrauens. Lass dich regelmässig untersuchen. Viele Geschlechtskrankheiten machen sich kaum oder erst spät bemerkbar.|~|Translation: There are a lot of sexually transmitted diseases around. Use a condom. They reduce the risk of infection but not completely. Pay attention to your body. If you notice changes ask a doctor you trust. Get regular check-ups. Many diseases are only noticeable too late.
Description.note: Poster depicts the legs of several men, some standing in front of and some behind a wrought iron fence. The men are wearing shorts, leather pants or jeans and leather chaps. The suggestion is that they are having anonymous sex.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW187.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Familien-Bande
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Familien-Bande
Description.inscription: Additional text: Uns trennt so vieles. Oder?|~|Translation: So much separates us. Or?
Description.note: Pastoral scene with seven people of varied gender, ethnicity, age, physical ability and possibly socio-economic status and sexual orientation. They are sitting or lying on and around a blanket on which there is a picnic basket and drinks spread out. Suggests that people can be brought together because of HIV and this is more important than their differences.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW188.
Alternate Title.translated: Family group

Item Title: Listen, learn, live
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Listen, learn, live
Description.note: Depicts young people of various ethnicities. Part of a campaign in Germany encouraging understanding and acceptance of foreigners. Suggestion is that foreigners do not bring HIV or AIDS into Germany.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW189.
Alternate Title.translated: Listen to each other, learn from each other, live with another
Alternate Title.inscribed: Einander zuhören, voneinander lernen, miteinander leben

Item Title: Besser allein.
Subject.conceptTopic: Gay men|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Besser allein.
Description.inscription: Niemand ist gern einsam.  Zum zusammensein gehören Unabhängigkeit, Freiheit, Klarheit über eigene Ansprüche und Wünsche.Drum nimm dein Leben in die eigenen Hände.  Du bist verantwortlich - nicht nur beim Sex.  Sei du selbst, ohne faule Kompromisse.Für dich und deine Partner.  Für den Spass, die Liebe und das Leben mit anderen.
Description.note: Five men are depicted, each explaining why life is better alone.  The poster text cautions that no one wants to be truly alone and one must practice safe sex to keep himself and his partners healthy.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW190.
Alternate Title.translated: Better alone.

Item Title: Force for change
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Force for change
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Wir können was verändern. Wir gehören zusammen.|~|Translated poster text: We can change something. We belong together.
Description.note: Multicolored depiction divided into a 3x3 arrangement of nine panels. The first eight panels each contain a person which is a composite of two halves of different faces. The people depicted are from different races, ethnicities, and age groups. The last panel shows a picture of the AIDS ribbon and a vertically aligned rainbow.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW191.

Item Title: Schwule Vielfalt, schwule Solidarität
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Mudra, Wolfgang
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Schwule Vielfalt, schwule Solidarität
Description.note: Black and white illustration divided into twelve panels. Each panel contains one or two gay males of varying ages. Letters of text written in red, pink, or white.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW192.
Alternate Title.translated: Gay diversity, gay solidarity

Item Title: Safer Use, Sauberes Spritzbesteck und Zubehör : Safer Sex, Kondome beim Sex
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Lauterbach, Martina
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Safer Use, Sauberes Spritzbesteck und Zubehör : Safer Sex, Kondome beim Sex
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Safer Use und Safer Sex schützen vor HIV/AIDS und senken das Risiko einer Ansteckung mit Hepatitis und anderen Krankheiten!|~|Translation of poster text: Safer sex and safer use of syringe needles protects against AIDS and lowers the risk of hepatitis and other infectious diseases.
Description.note: Colored abstract illustration of two men and two women in an indoor warehouse-like location. Male in foreground (bottom left portion of poster) is preparing to inject drugs intravenously.  Women in foreground (center of poster) has a cigarette in her mouth and left arm crossed in front (so that hand is reaching ear?), seated near a used hypodermic needle. Male in background (bottom right of poster) standing shirtless, band tied around wrist, about to inject (or just finished injecting?) intravenous drugs. Women in background (upper right portion of poster) standing but slouched over indiscriminate orange object (as if typing or playing a keyboard?)|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW193.
Alternate Title.translated: Safe use with clean hypodermic equipment : Safe sex with condoms

Title: Was sich liebt, das schützt sich [inscribed]

Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW194.|~|Date on back of poster, 1995, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Schwul leben [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Pusch, Detlev
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Schwul leben [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Text: Unser Leben ist von Aids nicht mehr zu trennen. Und trotzdem: Schwul leben ist mehr. [Our lives can no longer be separated from AIDS. Even so: living gay is more.]
Description.note: Black and white photograph depicting a group of six gay males congregrating, mostly sitting. Most are smiling.|~|Related poster titles: "Bewusst leben" and "Positiv leben."|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW195.
Alternate Title.translated: Live gay

Item Title: Bewusst leben [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Pusch, Detlev
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Bewusst leben [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Text: Sexualität hat viele Möglichkeiten. Safer Sex heisst, seine Phantasie zu benutzen. Und das Kondom. [Sexuality has many possibilities. Safe sex means using your imagination. And a condom.]
Description.note: Black and white photograph of a nude male being embraced from behind by another male. Angle of lighting during the shoot casts a shadow on the males.|~|Related poster titles: "Schwul leben" and "Positiv leben."|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW196.
Alternate Title.translated: Live consciously

Item Title: Bedürfnisse haben Recht. [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Assistance|~|AIDS (Disease)--Patients--Services for|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome|~|HIV-positive persons--Counseling of|~|Community health services|~|AIDS (Disease)--Patients--Counseling of|~|HIV-positive persons--Services for
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Bedürfnisse haben Recht. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Text: Hiv positiv. Lebensqualität für dich vielleicht ein Fremdwort? Aber es gibt eine Reihe von staatlichen Zuschüssen und Vergünstigungen. Verzichte nicht aus Scham oder Angst auf das, was dir zusteht. Es sind keine Almosen -- du hast ein Recht darauf! Beratung, Information und tatkräftige Unterstützung bekommst du bei den Mitarbeiterinnen der AIDS-Hilfen. [HIV positive. Is quality of life a foreign word to you? But there is a set of state subsidies and privileges. Don't do without things you're entitled to because of shame or fear. This isn't charity -- you have a right to it! You can get consultation, information and strong support from AIDS-Hilfe employees.]
Description.note: Color depiction divided into three panels--one on top and two below.  Each panel consists of a photograph of a woman.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW197.
Alternate Title.translated: Needs have rights

Item Title: Heimat Szene? [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Mudra, Wolfgang
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Heimat Szene? [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Aufmerksamkeit statt Nicht(be)achtung. [Awareness instead of not paying attention.]
Description.note: Photograph of party-scene with men standing. Most of the men are clothed in black T-shirts and black pants while the rest are nude. The clothed men are interacting with each other. No one is interacting with the nude men, and many of them are staring at something off in the distance.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW198.
Alternate Title.translated: Homeland scene

Item Title: Positiv leben [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Pusch, Detlev
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Positiv leben [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Text: Jeder kann positiv sein. Ohne es zu wissen. Das Heisst für jeden, sich und andere zu schützen. Eben positiv leben. [Anyone could be positive. Without knowing it. That means everyone should protect himself and others. Just live positively.]
Description.note: Related poster titles: "Bewusst leben" and "Schwul leben."|~|Black and white photographical depiction of two males in a bar. One whispers into the ear of the other. Two glasses of wine are on the bar counter.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW199.
Alternate Title.translated: Live positively

Item Title: Nein zum anfixen [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Jahreiss, M.|~|Pusch, Detlev|~|Warzecha, R.
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nein zum anfixen [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Text: Schon das erste Experiment mit einem gebrauchten Spritzbesteck kann zur HIV-Infektion führen. [Even the first experiment with a used hypodermic can lead to HIV infection.]
Description.note: Photographic depiction of a young male and a young female conversing.  They are standing in a back alley.  He is leaning against a bicycle, while she is leaning against a fence.  A third male is walking by in background. There is graffiti written on a wall in the background which says: HEROIN RAUS! [Out with heroin!]|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW200.
Alternate Title.translated: No to shooting up

Item Title: Mann hat's. [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Safe Sex
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Jahreiss, M.|~|Pusch, Detlev|~|Warzecha, R.
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Mann hat's. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Text: Das Kondom in der Tasche und den Mut darüber zu reden. So kommt man sich näher. [A condom in his pocket and the courage to talk about it. This is how we get closer.]
Description.note: Blurred photographic depiction of a young female and two young males in a club-like scene. The female is seated a table which has two alcoholic drinks on it. One of the males is leaning towards the female, holding his arm around her. The other male is seated at the table facing the first male and the female. Both males are holding condoms and showing them to each other. Part of the seated male's reflection can be seen in a nearby mirror. Several other people are standing in the background.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW201.
Alternate Title.translated: He's got it.

Item Title: Nicht um jeden Preis--aber sicher [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|Sexually transmitted diseases--Prevention|~|HIV infections--Prevention
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Heuler, Norbert|~|Pusch, Detlev
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nicht um jeden Preis--aber sicher [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Beim Bumsen und Blasen schützt ein Gummi vor sexuell übertragbaren Krankheiten. [With fucking and blow jobs a condom protects against sexually-transmitted diseases.]
Description.note: Young male with open shirt, holding a glass of beer and leaning against a bar counter. Looking at (or speaking with?) another male. Text implies he may be a sex worker.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW202.
Alternate Title.translated: Not at any price--of course.

Item Title: Man as son, patient, employee, and customer [descriptive]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Mudra, Wolfgang
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Man as son, patient, employee, and customer [descriptive]
Description.inscription: Poster text: Er ist Sohn, Patient, Angestellter, Kunde. Er ist schwul.  Er hat weniger Rechte. [He is son, patient, employee, customer. He is gay. He has fewer rights.]
Description.note: Four panel depiction of a young male in various roles. Upper left panel depicts him assisting his mother with her blouse. Upper right panel depicts him on an examination table during his visit to the doctor. Lower left panel depicts him seated at a desk helping a client fill out an application. Lower right panel depicts him speaking with a woman (a store employee?) about a product he is holding.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW203.

Item Title: Family takes care [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Mudra, Wolfgang
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Family takes care [inscribed]
Description.note: Seven people of diverse backgrounds gathered together, smiling for a group photo. The scene is in a field where they are at a picnic. The photograph is shot in black and white. The majority of the picture is in grey scale, but a strip 1/3 of the poster's width is sepia-toned.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW204.

Item Title: Okay: Ich bin schwul. Ich bin stark [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Okay: Ich bin schwul. Ich bin stark [inscribed]
Description.note: Sepia-toned photograph of a young gay male front and center, with two other males in the background.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW205.
Alternate Title.translated: Okay: I am gay. I am strong.

Title: Zeit für Safer Sex [inscribed]

(Image is suggestive of sundial about to strike noon?)|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW206.

Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Deutsche AIDS-Hilfe e.V.
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Bewusst Sein: I Care…Do You? [inscribed]

His thumbs are hooked into the waistband of his pants, and he is looking directly at the viewer.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW207.

Item Title: Amit az AIDS-ről és megelőzéséről tudni kell
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Amit az AIDS-ről és megelőzéséről tudni kell
Description.note: Poster provides extensive textual information about AIDS & HIV transmission and prevention, including the role of drug and alcohol abuse in promoting risky behavior. A cartoon bird is depicted bringing information to the reader, and a cartoon monster represents the virus itself. Text also provides information about hotlines and other services, some anonymous, that provide information, testing and counseling services.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item HU001.
Alternate Title.translated: What one needs to know about AIDS and how to prevent it
Format.dimensions: 43 cm. x 61 cm. (17 in. x 24 in.)

Item Title: De ha máshova mész el-- akkor védekezz!
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: De ha máshova mész el-- akkor védekezz!
Description.note: Poster depicts a blue movie ticket on a red background, and suggests that if a couple's date goes beyond just seeing a movie and includes sexual activity, protective measures should be taken.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item HU002.|~|Date on back of poster, 1997, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: But if you go somewhere else, then you have to protect yourself

Item Title: Ein fjölskylda gegn alnæmi. Umræða án fordóma [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Ein fjölskylda gegn alnæmi. Umræða án fordóma [inscribed]
Description.note: Poster with red and black text on a white background, with a black and white image of a group of individuals, possibly a family, linking arms and partially circling a globe. The individuals who are facing forward are wearing red AIDS ribbons.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item IC001.|~|Date on back of poster, 2002, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: One family against AIDS. Discussion without prejudice

Item Title: Þad er Þess virdi! [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Þad er Þess virdi! [inscribed]
Description.note: A multicolored cartoon without words depicts a man and a woman sitting on a bed. A voice "balloon" coming from the man has a picture of a condom in it. The next frames depict a hand holding a condom, and then a hand with colored nail polish putting a condom on an erect penis. The final frame shows the man and woman in bed with their eyes closed, possibly asleep, and covered by a sheet or blanket.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item IC002.|~|Date on back of poster, 2002, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: It's worth it!

Title: AIDS is your responsibility. Protect your schools through education

The instructor is at the blackboard, pointing at the question "Responsible behaviour?" written in chalk.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item II001.|~|Date on back of poster, 1998, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Skul mẹ milī muzhe eds kī jankarī kya tumhe bhī?
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: All-India Institute of Medical Sciences. AIDS Education & Training Cell
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Skul mẹ milī muzhe eds kī jankarī kya tumhe bhī?
Description.note: Poster features a photograph of the torso of a young man looking pleasantly at the camera, with his jacket draped over one shoulder. He appears to be standing in the corridor of a school, as indicated by the poster's text.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item II002.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: At school I received information about AIDS, how about you?

Item Title: AIDS : still no cure. Follow safe sex practices
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Central Council of Health & Family Welfare (India)
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: AIDS : still no cure. Follow safe sex practices
Description.note: Poster depicts a doctor, arms crossed, frowning at a figure of a person who is being crushed by a large, black rectangular space which contains the poster text. The picture emphasizes the message: there is no cure for AIDS, so use protection.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item II003.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Gaye piya pardesh kamane, eds na lekar aỵe. Paranarī se bache piya, to ghar mẹ eds kabhī na sataye. Asurakshit yaun sambanḍh eds phailta hai!
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: All-India Institute of Medical Sciences. NGO AIDS Cell|~|East-West Committee (London, England)
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Gaye piya pardesh kamane, eds na lekar aỵe. Paranarī se bache piya, to ghar mẹ eds kabhī na sataye. Asurakshit yaun sambanḍh eds phailta hai!
Description.note: Depicts three Hindi women, dressed in traditional clothing, sitting on a rug. They are talking to one another. It can be inferred that they are discussing the possibility of a husband contracting AIDS while overseas. The poster cautions to use protection when having sex with strangers.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item II004.
Alternate Title.translated: My beloved has gone overseas to earn a living. I hope he does not return with AIDS. Protect yourself from a strange woman, so that AIDS may never enter. AIDS spreads due to unprotected sex!

Item Title: Yad Rakhẹ...Aap dhan kamane pardesh ja rahe hai, eds nahī!
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: All-India Institute of Medical Sciences. NGO AIDS Cell
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: East-West Committee (London, England)
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Yad Rakhẹ...Aap dhan kamane pardesh ja rahe hai, eds nahī!
Description.note: Poster depicts a painting of a young man, with a knapsack across his shoulder and a bag of belongings in his hand, walking away from a small house. The text reminds him to protect himself against AIDS while he is abroad working.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item II005.
Alternate Title.translated: Remember...You are going abroad to earn a living, not to have AIDS!

History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item II006.|~|Date on back of poster, 1999, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Test HIV : 10 buone norme per gli operatori sanitari che eseguono il test HIV [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Commissione nazionale per la lotta contro l'AIDS
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Test HIV : 10 buone norme per gli operatori sanitari che eseguono il test HIV [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: V Campagna informativo-educativa sull'AIDS... Fermare l'AIDS. Umanamente possibile.|~|Translation of poster text: The fifth informative-educational campaign on AIDS... Stop AIDS... It is humanly possible.
Description.note: The poster lists 10 suggestions for those who might be administering an HIV test or counseling about HIV testing. It reminds people to be sensitive, polite, careful, clear, patient, etc., when dealing with individuals who might be seeking or undergoing HIV testing. The poster has a blue border, and its right side is adorned with colorful question marks. An outline of a man is tumbling down the question marks, suggestive of a person who has many questions about HIV and might be feeling helpless.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item IT001.|~|Date on back of poster, 1997, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Test HIV : 10 good norms for health officers to perform HIV testing
Alternate Title.other: Test HIV : dieci buone norme per gli operatori sanitari che eseguono il test HIV

Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|World AIDS Day|~|Safe Sex|~|Families|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Love

Title: Poster of two doves kissing with a heart

It suggests the importance of using a condom for the safety of a family.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item JA001.

Item Title: Poster of an elderly couple representing compassion [descriptive]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Poster of an elderly couple representing compassion [descriptive]
Description.inscription: Text: Non, ce n'est pas notre cas. Mais nos enfants et nos petits enfants ne sont pas a l'abri. S'ils contractaient le SIDA, nous ne les laisserons pas tomber pour autant. Car, ils auraient encore plus besoin de notre soutien et de notre affection. Et vous, comment réagirrez-vous face a une atteinte du SIDA?
Description.note: Part of "AIDS betrëfft eis all. Gitt op Nummer sécher."|~|Photograph of an elderly couple. Poster encourages individuals to have compassion for HIV-infected people, especially family members.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item LU001.|~|Date on back of poster, 1996, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.other: Mir AIDS?|~|AIDS betrëfft eis all. Gitt op Nummer sécher
Alternate Title.descriptive: Elderly couple poster

Item Title: Poster of young people urging to have fun responsibly through safe sex [descriptive]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Poster of young people urging to have fun responsibly through safe sex [descriptive]
Description.inscription: Les discos, les concerts et les soirées folles, c'est ça la jeunesse. S'amuser, draguer et tomber amoureux. Des fois, ça même au lit dans les bras de notre conquête. Notre comportement n'a pas trop changé depuis qu'on parle du SIDA, sauf que nous utilisons maintenant des préservatifs.
Description.note: Part of "AIDS betrëfft eis all. Gitt op Nummer sécher."|~|Photograph of young people. Poster describes the pleasures of youth--partying, having fun, falling in love, and having sex. The poster stresses that concerns over AIDS need not keep young people from experiencing these pleasures, as long as they practice safe sex.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item LU004.
Alternate Title.other: Mir? AIDS?|~|AIDS betrëfft eis all. Gitt op Nummer sécher
Alternate Title.descriptive: Young people poster

Title: Poster of a positive sign encircled [descriptive]
