Description.note: Poster depicts a head and arms of a young woman wearing a sweater.|~|Part of "America Responds to AIDS" campaign.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US030.
Alternate Title.inscribed: What have you got against a condom?|~|America responds to AIDS

Item Title: How much do your children know about AIDS?
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: How much do your children know about AIDS?
Description.inscription: Poster text: How much do your children know about AIDS? Your children need an understanding of what it takes to be healthy. Schools can play an important role. If you'd like to know how you as a parent can be more involved in your school's curriculum, call 1-800-342-AIDS for information. For the hearing impaired, 1-800-AIDS-TTY. America responds to AIDS.
Description.note: Poster shows a group of children of different races.|~|Part of "America Responds to AIDS" campaign.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US031.

Item Title: This is the way many people deal with HIV
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Centers for Disease Control (U.S.)|~|United States. Public Health Service
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: This is the way many people deal with HIV
Description.inscription: Poster text: This is the way many people deal with HIV. A lot of people don't think they have to worry about HIV. But the truth is, anyone can get HIV infection if they are sharing drug needles and syringes or having sex with an infected person. Call your State of local AIDS hotline. Or call the National AIDS Hotline at 1-800-342-AIDS. Call 1-800-243-7889 (TTY) for deaf access. HIV is the virus that causes AIDS. America Responds to AIDS.
Description.note: Poster depicts three people acting like the "see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil" monkeys. A man covers his eyes, a woman covers her ears, and another man covers his mouth.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US032.

Item Title: If he doesn't have a condom, you just have to take a deep breath and tell him to go get one
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Condoms|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Communication
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (U.S.)|~|United States. Public Health Service
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: If he doesn't have a condom, you just have to take a deep breath and tell him to go get one
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: It's not the easiest thing in the world to say. But these days, you have to. If you're dating someone who doesn't like condoms, talk before having sex. Explain how you feel. Offer to help during the awkward moments. And if this doesn't work, ask yourself, is it worth the risk? For more information on condoms and AIDS, call 1-800-342-AIDS for answers you can count on. America responds to AIDS
Description.note: Poster depicts a woman sitting on a chair, with one foot on the seat of the chair.|~|Part of "America Responds to AIDS" campaign.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US033.

Item Title: Don't just worry about HIV. Do something about it.
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (U.S.)|~|United States. Public Health Service
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Don't just worry about HIV. Do something about it.
Description.inscription: Poster text: Don't just worry about HIV. Do something about it. If you think you are at risk for HIV infection, now's the time to consider counseling and testing. If you test positive, work with a doctor to make decisions that are right for you. The earlier this happens, the more medical care can help. Talk to a doctor, your health department, or other local AIDS resources. Call your State or local AIDS hotline, or the National AIDS Hotline at 1-800-342-AIDS. Call 1-800-243-7889 (TTY) for deaf access. HIV is the virus that causes AIDS. America responds to AIDS.
Description.note: Poster depicts the face of a worried-looking African-American man.|~|Part of "America Responds to AIDS" campaign.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US034.

Item Title: Some people think they come of age when they've been burnt by gonorrhea...
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)|~|Sexually transmitted diseases|~|Adolescence|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome|~|Coming of age|~|Gonorrhea|~|Death
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Centers for Disease Control (U.S.)|~|United States. Public Health Service
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Some people think they come of age when they've been burnt by gonorrhea...
Description.inscription: Some people think they come of age when they've been burnt by gonorrhea, but if they've been burnt by AIDS they may never come of age. To find out more about the relationship between AIDS and VD, call the National AIDS Hotline at 1-800-342-AIDS. The hotline for the hearing impaired is 1-800-AIDS-TTY. America Responds to AIDS
Description.note: Poster depicts a young African-American man standing against a chain-link fence.|~|Part of "America responds to AIDS" campaign.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US035.

Item Title: If you cheat on your partner you could wind up with more than just a broken heart.
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (U.S.)|~|United States. Public Health Service
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: If you cheat on your partner you could wind up with more than just a broken heart.
Description.inscription: Poster text: If you cheat on your partner you could wind up with more than just a broken heart. With AIDS around, cheating on your partner could cheat you both out of your lives. AIDS is deadly. Even one encounter could infect you with the AIDS virus. So what started out as a harmless flirtation could turn into a deadly moment of truth. That's why it's important to know your partner. Because a broken heart is bad, but not as bad as a broken life. For more information about AIDS, call 1-800-342-AIDS. America responds to AIDS
Description.note: Poster depicts an African-American man and woman holding hands.|~|Part of "America Responds to AIDS" campaign.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US036.

Item Title: Hey! You know what? You can't get AIDS from...
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Hey! You know what? You can't get AIDS from...
Description.inscription: Hey! You know what? You can't get AIDS from: eating at restaurants, using toilets in public spaces, mosquito bites, giving someone a hug or kiss, sharing food with friends, playing on playgrounds, visiting someone who is sick with AIDS, going to the doctor, AIDS is not spread by things we touch!
Description.note: Poster consists of nine panels with colorful drawings depicting people, mostly children, doing things that don't transmit AIDS. The poster is targeted at children.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US037.|~|Date on back of poster, 2002, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Opciones para las mujeres
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Opciones para las mujeres
Description.inscription: Poster text: Opciones para las mujeres, Qué puede hacer usted para protegerse del SIDA durante las relaciones sexuales? Absternerse o...
Description.note: Poster lists four options for lessening the chance of AIDS transmission during sex. In order of decreasing effectiveness: using a condom and spermicide;  using a condom only; using a diaphragm and vaginal spermicide; and using spermicide only. Five women are pictured individually, one may be a doctor.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US038.|~|Date on back of poster, 1996, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Options for women

Item Title: Si tu has tenido sexo con dos personas...
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Si tu has tenido sexo con dos personas...
Description.inscription: Poster text: Si tu has tenido sexo con dos personas y esas dos personas cada una habia tenido sexo con otras dos personas y esas personas cada una habia tenido sexo con otras dos personas y... entonces es como si tú hubieras tenido sexo con 1,022 personas. Cualquiera pudo haberte infectado con el VIH - el virus que causa el SIDA. Para saber qué hacer ahora, llama gratis al servicio de información del VIH en Texas. 1-800-299-2437, Todas las llamadas son anónimas.|~|Translated poster text: If you have had sex with two people and each of those two people had had sex with two other people and each of those people had had sex with two other people... then it is as if you have had sex with 1,022 people. Any one of them could have been infected with HIV - the virus that causes AIDS...
Description.note: Poster is designed like an eye chart, with one very large word on the first line, three words in smaller type on the next line, etc. until the type is extremely tiny. The poster demonstrates the exponential nature of exposure to AIDS, as a person is susceptible to disease carried by people they have sex with, people they had had sex with before, etc.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US039.
Alternate Title.translated: If you have had sex with two people...

Item Title: I have AIDS, please hug me
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: I have AIDS, please hug me
Description.inscription: I have AIDS, please hug me, I can't make you sick
Description.note: Poster depicts a child's crayon drawing of a boy with his arms out. The text, "I have AIDS, please hug me, I can't make you sick" is written in crayon.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US040.

Item Title: Condomplation
Personal or Corporate Name.designer: Hayes, Christopher, designer|~|Maryland Institute Design CO-OP
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Condomplation
Description.inscription: Poster text: Condomplation, There are a lot of things worth protecting. One of them is your life. Hero.
Description.note: Poster consists of large text on a black background, with unused condoms standing in for the first two O's in "CONDOMPLATION."|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US041.

Item Title: Tuô'i tré hãy cánh giác! SIDA : Vô phu'o'ng cú'u chu'a
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Công ty Mỹ thuât trung uong (Vietnam)|~|Trung tâm giáo duc dân só, súc khóe, môi tru'o'ng (Vietnam)
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Tuô'i tré hãy cánh giác! SIDA : Vô phu'o'ng cú'u chu'a
Description.note: Poster features text on a blue background, surrounding a drawing of a large, ringing bell. The word "SIDA" appears in large type under the bell. The poster is "ringing" out a loud message to young people that AIDS is a dangerous, incurable disease. Youth need to be vigilant in using protection against the disease.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item VM001.
Alternate Title.translated: Youth, be vigilant! AIDS. No way to cure

Item Title: AIDS : může mít podobu anděla
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: AIDS : může mít podobu anděla
Description.note: Poster is a sketch of a nude female angel from the torso up. She is looking straight ahead. The word "AIDS" is inscribed at the top in large with lettering, with the "I" in red. It appears as though the letter has been scribbled through with a red pencil. The poster serves as a caution: AIDS can be contracted from anyone, even those that appear as wonderful as an angel.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item XR001.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS : it can take the shape of an angel

Item Title: AIDS-- nezná vyvolených!
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: AIDS-- nezná vyvolených!
Description.note: Artistic images and photographs of Anthony Perkins, Magic Johnson and Freddie Mercury, all of whom suffered from AIDS or HIV.|~|From campaign: Jistota věrnosti, prevence AIDS.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item XR002.

Item Title: Women, girls and HIV/AIDS [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|HIV (Viruses)|~|Women--Health and welfare|~|Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome|~|AIDS (Disease) in women|~|World AIDS Day|~|Sexually transmitted diseases--Prevention|~|Responsibility|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|Condom use|~|Unsafe sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Condoms--utilization|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (U.S.)|~|United States. Agency for International Development|~|Canadian International Development Agency|~|Great Britain. Dept. for International Development|~|French Technical Cooperation
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Women, girls and HIV/AIDS [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Women and Girls are three to six time more likely than men to contract HIV.  Take the lead NOW.  Trust in Protection.Having sex with only one partner can be high-risk behavior -- because your partner's sexual behaviour.  Trust in Protection. Marriage or living with someone does not guarantee protection against HIV infection.  Take the lead NOW.  Trust in Protection.Women and girls are twice as likely as men to contract HIV from a single act of unprotected sex, yet they leave protection up to men.  Take the lead NOW.  Trust in Protection.Men, boys and social institutions can help improve the plight of women and girls when it comes to the AIDS epidemic.  Support protection for women.Education and economic empowerment can stop the spread of HIV.  Not chance.  Not luck. Trust in protection.|~|Additional poster text: Take the lead now.  Not chance, not luck.  Trust in protection.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item TR001.|~|The poster is a long narrow poster with a 2005 calander printed on it. At the top of the poster there are five photographs of smiling faces of people of different races and ages. Under the pictures there is a red AIDS ribbon with several country flags on one end of the ribbon and the logo for Caribbean Epidemiology Centre (CAREC) PAHO/WHO on the other end of the ribbon. At the bottom of the poster there are logos for the three main organizations that have published and sponsored the poster.  The websites for the Caribbean Epidemiology Centre are: www.carec.org and www.catin.org.|~|Date on back of poster, 2005, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: ...at home ...away [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text:  HIV transmission can take place either at home or while you are away.  Be prepared when you travel - think about the situations you may find yourself in.  Pack condoms and lube - they aren't available everywhere.  For more information for gay men who are traveling, check out the free booklet from your local AIDS council or visit www.afao.org.au.

Item Title: Be free [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|HIV infections--Diagnosis|~|Prostitutes|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Women, Black|~|Hotlines (Communication)--Italy
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Gruppo C |~|Progetto Sirio|~|Azienda Ulss 20 di Verona
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Be free [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Translated poster text: Help line. AIDS information. Anonymous HIV testing. Unprotected sexual relations are a risk to health. Call Gruppo C of the Center for Preventive Medicine.|~|Additional poster text: 045 8622232 Help line. Informazioni AIDS. Test HIV in anonimato. Per uscire dalla prostituzione e dallo sfruttamento; For freedom from prostitution and from sexual exploitation; Pour sortir de la prostitution et de l'exploitation. I rapporti sessuali non protetti sono un rischio per la salute. Chiama il Gruppo C del Centro di Medicina Preventiva. Safe sex only [in background of poster].
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item IT017.|~|This poster is targeted at black prostitutes and sex workers, many of whom emigrated to Italy's major cities from North Africa. The language of the text is in Italian, English and French so that it can be understood by women who came from other countries.|~|Most of the poster is a striking graphic of a woman's face, with white areas suggesting her forehead, nose and cheeks, and with blue-green eyeshadow and red lips, all against a dark brown background.  The cheeks, forehead, nose, eyes and lips are composed of very small graphics of female sex workers in various suggestive poses, but they cannot be seen distinctly until the poster is viewed close-up. The brown background suggests that the woman is black.|~|Date on back of poster, 2006, reflects when the vendor received  the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: AIDS in the world. [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: AIDS in the world. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: The pandemic and the response; The Pandemic: by the year 2000, 38 to 110 million adults may be HIV infected--an effective response can make the difference; The challenge: the gap between the pandemic and the current response is growing rapidly.  The world needs a new approach--A new health strategy for AIDS; Cumulative HIV infections as of January 1, 1993.
Description.note: Poster shows a map of the world and the numbers of people infected with HIV in the major regions of the world.  It shows the total number of people infected, and then breaks down the information into categories of men, women, and children infected with HIV.  There is also a bar graph of the statistics in reference to industrialized countries and developing countries.  There is also a timeline visually displaying the growing numbers of AIDS infected people through the years.

Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item SZ071.|~|Four photographs are atop a red background.  Each photograph contains HIV positive and negative people with a message about their lives in their own handwriting.

Item Title: Down low [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Down low [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Two-thirds (63%) of all women reported with AIDS were African American. -Center for Disease Control & Prevention; What you don't know can kill you...;...Get the facts.  Get tested!; For more information about HIV/STD testing, contact your local health department.
Description.note: Poster is of a well dressed African American couple getting propositioned by a seedy looking African American male in gangster attire.  Poster suggests that many people are in denial that HIV is so prevalent and ignore the issue.  Poster states that doing this can be fatal, and one should get tested for HIV.

Item Title: For a person living with HIV Cotrimoxazole can be life saving! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: HIV-positive persons|~|HIV (Viruses)--Treatment|~|AIDS-related complex|~|Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole Combination|~|HIV Infections--drug therapy|~|Political participation|~|Co-trimoxazole|~|HIV drug effects
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: For a person living with HIV Cotrimoxazole can be life saving! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Cotrimoxazole is also called Bactrim, Purbac, Cozole, Nucotrim... Each company gives it a different name. This medicine can prevent PCP pneumonia, Toxoplasmosis stroke, illnesses common with HIV. Ensure a constant supply of Cotrimoxazole at your clinic!|~|Additional poster text: Support voluntary HIV counselling and testing. There are direct benefits if you know your HIV status. There are medicines that improve your health. Always practise safer sex and use condoms.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item SA003.|~|Background in orange and black; text in white & black. Picture of a man with folded arms. He is asking: “Have you tested HIV positive? You might need Cotrimoxazole.” The text: “Ensure a constant supply of Cotrimoxazole ay your clinic!” is surrounded by images of pills.

Item Title: Treat shingles with Acyclovir now! [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Treat shingles with Acyclovir now! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Shingles (Herpes zoster) causes:- painful blisters on a marked area on one side of the body.- possible blindness if it occurs in the face.- a scar that can burn badly.All this can be prevented if shingles is treated quickly with Acyclovir!Most government clinics do not provide Acyclovir. Let's campaign for it!|~|Additional poster text: Support voluntary HIV counseling and testing. There are direct benefits if you know your HIV status. There are medicines that improve your health. Always practise safer sex and use condoms.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item SA002.|~|Background in green and black; text in white & black. Picture of a man with folded arms. He is asking: “Does your clinic have Acyclovir?”Additional image of human back with the caption "Herpes zoster" on it. The text: “Most government clinics do not provide Acyclovir. Lets campaign for it!” is surrounded by images of pills. Poster calls for campaign to get government clinics to provide the right treatment for their clients.

Item Title: Implement an HIV/AIDS treatment plan to save lives: use affordable, quality generic ARVs to treat 150,000 South Africans with AIDS by 2004! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|HIV Infections--drug therapy|~|Anti-Retroviral Agents--therapeutic use|~|HIV infections--Treatment|~|Antiretroviral agents
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Implement an HIV/AIDS treatment plan to save lives: use affordable, quality generic ARVs to treat 150,000 South Africans with AIDS by 2004! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: "You can prevent HIV by using condoms & practicing safe sex at all times! If you test HIV positive and need treatment, Antiretrovirals (ARVs) can help. ARVs gave me back my health and took me back to my family and work." Vuyani Jacobs, one of 20,000 South Africans presently using ARVs.|~|For further informaiton on ARVs ask your doctor or contact TAC [Treatment Action Campaign] at: 021 788 3507; E-mail: info@tac.org.za; Website: www.tac.org.za|~|Selected additional poster text: ARVs are currently not available at public clinics and hospitals, we must campaign to change this. If you are on Medical AID or can afford ARVs, ask your doctor where you can buy them.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item SA001.|~|Poster is primarily textual, with 4 small images of South Africans depicted as advocates, organizers and patients. Poster advocates for the aggressive use of Antiretroviral drugs (ARVs) to treat the 150,000 South Africans infected with AIDS by 2004.

Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|HIV (Viruses)|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Condom use|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: You don't have to divulge to indulge. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text:  We make a lot of decisions when negotiating casual sex.  Using a condom means we can play without needing to know our partner's HIV status and protects everyone's privacy as well as our health.  Whether you're negative or positive, always use a condom.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AT022.|~|At the bottom of the poster there are two logos from the Queensland AIDS Council as well as the phone numbers and e-mail address for the council.  The e-mail address is:  info@quac.org.au|~|The poster is made up of a pile of different brands of condoms, water-based lubricant, a newspaper's "Men's Personals" section, watches, a clock, a flash device for a camera, some keys, a pen, one bottle with liquid in it, and Polaroid photos.|~|Date on back of poster, 2004, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item BL004.|~|Poster depicts an image inspired by Michelangelo's Creation of Adam fresco on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel. In this version, God is handing Adam a purple condom, giving him the means to protect his life. Cherubim are visible in the background.

Item Title: Relações sorodiscordantes [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: HIV-positive persons|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Relações sorodiscordantes [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Saber lidar com as differenças é  um grande desafio.  Com a AIDS também é assim.  Para vencer esse desafio, os casais com sorologias diferentes para o HIV podem contar com aliados importantes, dentre eles, os profissionais de saúde.  Esses profissionais devem prestar orientações e ajudar no combate a discriminação.  Toda forma de amor seguro vale a pena!|~|Additional poster text:  ABIA 21 2223 1040 www.abiaids.org.br|~|Translated poster text:  Knowing how to deal with differences is a big challenge.  With AIDS it's the same.  To overcome that challenge couples with different serologies for HIV can count on important allies, amongst them, health professionals.  These professionals should provide guidance and help battle discrimination.  All forms of safe love are worthwhile.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item BL003.|~|Poster depicts 6 circles outlined in red separated by male and female gender symbols. As a result three circles are to the right and three to the left of the gender symbols.  The circles have pictures of people. The first one of a family of four (mother, father, son and daughter). Next circle has a picture of a couple (man and woman). The third circle has a picture of a homosexual couple.  The fourth circle has a picture of a group of teenagers which includes two girls and two boys.  The fifth circle has a picture of a lesbian couple. Final circle depicts a couple (an elderly man and woman). The poster is about relationships in which one person is HIV positive and the other is negative.
Alternate Title.translated: Serodiscordant relationships

Phone 830 3156; Monday to Friday 9:00 am to 9:00 pm and say that you want to know about STD/HIV/AIDS; Private, fast, and safe; It is your friend: HelpLine.|~|Additional poster text: Quién pudiera ayudarme?; No se lo puedo contar a nadie?; Si tuviera a quién preguntarle?; Llama al teléfono 830 3156; de Lunes a Viernes de 9:00 am a 9:00 pm y consulta lo que quieras saber sobre ITS/VIH/SIDA; Privada, rápida y segura; así es tu amiga; LíneAyuda.

A picture of a red AIDS ribbon takes the place of a photograph in one spot around the dial. Poster also includes a check list of common questions and concerns about AIDS and calling a helpline.

Ni pensarlo!; No se confunda que estoy protegido; Carrito por la vida; Centro Nacional de Prevención de las ITS/VIH/SIDA; Calle 27 No. 707 e/ A y B Plaza, Ciudad de la Habana; Telf.: 831 1606 y 830 2017.|~|Translated poster text: Without a condom?  Don't think about it!; Don't assume that I'm protected; Cart for life.

History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item CU002.|~|Poster is a picture of a man looking over his shoulder, with a quoted comment.  There is also a picture of a van pulling a cart that is described as the "Cart for life". The words "si" and "da" appear together in the title, corresponding to the Spanish acronym for AIDS (SIDA). An AIDS ribbon appears in the middle of a slogan about using condoms.

Item Title: Bioseguridad [inscribed]
Subject.descriptiveTopic: Medical personnel|~|Medical equipment & supplies|~|Hands|~|Hypodermic syringes|~|Dental equipment & supplies
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Bioseguridad [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: La frecuencia de exposición accidental de los trabajadores de la salud al VIH depende en gran medida de su actitud hacia la bioseguridad; Cumpla con las medidas de precaución universal e incorpórelas a su práctica diaria.|~|Translated poster text: The frequency of accidental exposure of health workers to HIV depends largely on their attitude towards biosafety; Comply with the universal precaution measures and incorporate them into your daily practices.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item CU007.|~|This poster discusses the importance of biosafety when it comes to health workers.  HIV can be transmitted if one is not careful to practice biosafety measures.  The poster shows pictures of medical workers wearing masks, gloved hands using hypodermic syringes and performing a dental exam, and a pair of hands being washed.

Item Title: Só tens uma vida, usa o preservativo [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--transmission|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|AIDS (Disease)--Transmission
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Só tens uma vida, usa o preservativo [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Joy stick. Playstation.  Game over.|~|Poster is part of "...porque a SIDA existe" [... because AIDS exits] campaign.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO017.|~|Poster depicts three images in three different squares. The top square has an image of a nude male body; another square with the words "joy stick" covers the male's genital area.  The second square depicts a female nude body with another square covering her genital area; that square has "play station" words in it. Third square has an image of what could be interpreted as a cell explosion. A square with "game over" covers the center of that image. On the very bottom of the poster there an image of an unwrapped condom. The poster depicts the male penis as being the joy stick and the women's vagina as bein the playstation and the game over being when both come into contact and no protection is used. Resulting in HIV infection.
Alternate Title.translated: You only have one life, use a condom

Item Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você?  [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você?  [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Número Verde: 800 225 115 email: abraco@mail.telepac.pt|~|Poster is part of "Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001" [World Campaign Against AIDS 2001].|~|Additional poster text: "Esta é uma causa justa." Ricardo Sá Fernandes, Advogado. ["This is a just cause." Ricardo Sá Fernandes, Lawyer.]|~|Poster is part of "...porque a SIDA existe: campaign.  Translated additional poster text: "...because AIDS exists"|~|Additional poster text: "10 anos de Abraço. 10 anos de luta. E mais 10 anos lutarei enquanto houver alguem que não se preocupe. Palavras de ordem: Amor, Mimo, Cumplicidade, Solidariedade, Esclarecimento, Qualidade, Relação, Abertura, Teimosia, Curiosidade, Saber, Cuidado, Ternura, Alegria, Coragem, Força, Persistência, Persitência, Persistência, Persistência, Persistência, Persistência, Persistência, Persistência, Persistência, Persistência..."  Margarida Martins Presidente de Direcção Executiva, Coordenadora do Programa ABC - Ser Criança, Apoio Social e Domiciliário, Marketing Relações Públicas. ["10 years of Abraço. 10 years of struggle. And 10 more years I will struggle as long as there's someone who doesn't care. Words of order: Love, Spoil, Complicity, Solidarity, Enlightenment, Quality, Relation, Openness, Stubbornness, Curiosity, Knowledge, Happiness, Courage, Will, Persistence, Persistence, Persistence, Persistence, Persistence, Persistence, Persistence, Persistence, Persistence, Persistence..." Margarida Martins Executive management president, Coordinator of ABC program - Being a child social home support, marketing and public relations.]
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO022.|~|Poster depicts a man and a woman standing with views of a city in the background.
Alternate Title.translated: We worry about ourselves...and you?
Alternate Title.other: Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001|~|Porque a SIDA existe!

History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO019.|~|Poster depicts masked and caped superheroes (Batman and Robin?) holding hands against a dark blue sky. They have pink triangle symbols on their uniforms, and a triangle is being projected into the sky by a floodlight. Superheroes play a protective role, and so do condoms.
Alternate Title.translated: He is my hero. Use a condom.

Item Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você?  [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Martins, Margarida
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você?  [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: "Disse alguém que as mulheres carregam metade do céu. Se assim é, as mulheres seropositivas carregam o céu inteiro. Como mulher, sinto a obrigação de contribuir para a mudança da situação de milhões de mulheres que vivem com VIH/SIDA. Porque são sujeitas a uma dupla discriminação, mostram uma coragem do tamanho do universo."  Maria José Campos, médica, vice-presidente da Comissão Executiva Coordenadora da Rede Mediterrânica de Mulheres Confrontadas com a infecção peolo VIH. ["Someone says that women carry half of the sky, if that's the case then seropositive women carry the whole sky.  As a woman I feel the obligation to contribute to change in the situation of millions of women that live with HIV/AIDS.  Because they are subject to double discrimination, they demonstrate courage the size of the universe." Maria José Campos, doctor, vice-president of the executive commission, coordinator of the Mediterranean Network of Women Confronted by the HIV infection.]|~|Poster is part of "Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001" [World Campaign Against AIDS 2001].|~|Additional poster text: "SIDA não é sinónimo de morte, pode ser um convite à vida. É nosso dever não discriminar e abraçar quem precisa de nós." Helena Roseta, Arquitecta. ["AIDS is not a synonym for death, it can be an invitation to life.  It's our duty not to discriminate and give a hug to those who need us."  Helena Roseta, Architect.]|~|Número Verde: 800 225 115 email: abraco@mail.telepac.pt|~|Additional poster text: "A minha vida mudou porque eu tive a força para a mudar, mas foi a Abraço que me deu a mão para eu me levantar."  Ana Isabel Oliveira, Seropositiva / voluntáira. ["My life changed because I had the will to change it, but it was Abraço who gave me a hand to stand." Ana Isabel Oliveira, HIV positive / Volunteer]|~|Poster is part of "...porque a SIDA existe" [...because AIDS exists] campaign.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO016.|~|Poster depicts three women standing on a stairs holding on to the rail. Two of the women are wearing jeans and another wearing a skirt.
Alternate Title.translated: We worry about ourselves...and you?
Alternate Title.other: Porque a SIDA existe!|~|Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001

Item Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e tu? [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e tu? [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Poster is part of "...porque a SIDA existe: campaign.  Translated additional poster text: "...because AIDS exists"|~|Additional poster text: "O desafio que temos perante nós não é facil, mas não podemos perder tempo.  Temos que substituir a discriminação pela solidariedade. Temos que saber partilhar com aqueles que precisam de mais apoio. A SIDA é um problema de todos. Contem comigo."  Ricardo Sá Pinto Profissional de futebol. ["The challenge we have before us is not easy, but we cannot waste any time.  We have to substitute discrimination with solidarity. We have to know how to divide our support with those who need it the most. AIDS is everyone's problem. Count on me." Ricardo Sá Pinto Professional soccer player.]|~|Poster is part of "Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001" [World Campaign Against AIDS 2001].|~|Additional poster text: "Ajudar a tratar quem vive com esta infecção tem sido a minha batalha. Mas a querra só estará ganha quando cada um de nós se comprometer a não aumentar o número de infectados." Gabriela Rodrigues Médica, mãe de 4 filhos, voluntària do programa de prevenção da Abraço. ["To help care for those who live with this infection has been my battle.  But the war will not be won until each one of us compromises himself to not increase the number of infected." Gabriela Rodrigues, Dr., mother of 4, volunteer of the prevention program of Abraço.]|~|Número Verde: 800 225 115 email: abraco@mail.telepac.pt|~|Additional poster text: "Todos nós, jovens, devemos ter acesso à informação e a todos os meios de protecção da infecção pelo VIH (preservativos e material esterilizado de injecção). Devemos ser ouvidos e ter o direito de participar na construção dos programas de prevenção da transmissão da infecção pelo VIH." [All youth should have access to information and all means of protection against the HIV infection (condoms and sterilized materials for injections). We should be listened to and have the right to participate in the creation of prevention programs of transmission of the HIV infection.] Sérgio Luís Coordenador da região sul do programa de prevenção entre pares em meio escolar de Abraço
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO010b.|~|Poster depicts three people two men and a woman. The woman and a man are sitting down, the man is holding a soccer ball and another man stands behind them with his arms around them.
Alternate Title.translated: We worry about ourselves...and you?
Alternate Title.other: Porque a SIDA existe!|~|Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001

Item Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você? [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você? [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Poster is part of "...porque a SIDA existe" [...because AIDS exists].|~|Additional poster text:  "Ao longo destes 10 anos de convivência diária com o VIH, aprendi a dar importância às pequenas coisas da vida, as quais, normalmente, nos passam ao lado...E a lutar pelo respeito à normalidade de que jamais devemos abdicar.  Não estamos cá para sobreviver - - vivemos.  Todos os dias!"  Miguel Rodrigues Pereira, Seropositivo, fundador de Abraço. ["For as long as these 10 years of daily coexistence with HIV, I've learned to give importance to the small things in life, which normally pass us by...And to fight for respect to normalcy which we should never abdicate.  We are not here to survive - - we live everyday! Miguel Rodrigues Pereira, HIV positive, Abraço founder.]|~|Número Verde: 800 225 115e-mail: abraco@mail.telepac.pt|~|Part of "Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001" [World Campaign Against AIDS 2001].|~|Additional poster text: "A SIDA é uma questão de todos, que exige uma resposta de todos.  Responde-se à SIDA com prevenção e responsabilidade.  Com solidariedade e urgência."  Maria José RittaPresidente da Commisão Nacional para o Ano Internacional dos Voluntários. ["AIDS is a question to everyone that requires and answer of everyone. Answer AIDS back with prevention and responsibility. With solidarity and urgency."  Maria Jose Ritta, President of the National Commission for the International Volunteers Year.]
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO012.|~|Poster depicts a man and a woman both dressed in suits sitting on chairs next to each other.The location is outdoors and you can see trees in the background.
Alternate Title.translated: We worry about ourselves...and you?
Alternate Title.other: Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001|~|Porque a SIDA existe!

Item Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você?  [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Martins, Margarida
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você?  [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: "A informação objetiva, isenta, não discriminatória e sem avaliações moralistas é um dos vectores essenciais da Prevenção, associada à disponibilidade e fácil acesso aos meios de prevenção e redução de riscos e a um ambiente social favorável." "Por isso nós informamos, editando, desde 1996, a única publicação periódica em português de e para as pessoas com VIH/SIDA."  Pedro Silvério Marques Seropositivo, sócio fundador, membro da Comissão Executiva e director do Boletim da Abraço. ["Objective information, exempts without discrimination and without moralist evaluations as one of the essential factors of prevention associated with the availability and easy access to means of prevention and risk reduction and to a socially favorable environment.  That's why we inform by publishing, since 1996 as the only periodical information in portuguese for people with HIV/AIDS."  Pedro Silvério Marques Seropositive, partner founder, member of the Executive Commission and director of Boletim da Abraço.]|~|Número Verde: 800 225 115 email: abraco@mail.telepac.pt|~|Poster is part of "...porque a SIDA existe" ["... because AIDS exists"] campaign.|~|Poster is part of "Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001" [World Campaign Against AIDS 2001].|~|Additional poster text: "Lembrar que a SIDA representa, em certos países um novo holocausto, é um dever de jornalista. Lembrar que é preciso lutar contra os preconceitos, é um imperativo da cidadã."  Maria Elisa Domingues Jornalista. ["To remind that AIDS represents in certain countries a new holocaust, is a journalist duty. To remind that it's necessary to fight against prejudice is imperative of the citizen."  Maria Elisa Domingues Journalist.]
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO013.|~|Poster depicts a man and women sitting at a restaurant having dessert.
Alternate Title.translated: We worry about ourselves...and you?
Alternate Title.other: Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001|~|Porque a SIDA existe!

Item Title: Faça o primeiro gesto [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Faça o primeiro gesto [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text:  A sida não se transmite pela amizadeTranslated additional poster text:  Aids is not trasmitted through friendship
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO011.|~|Poster depicts a picture of a young man and a woman where only their backs are shown.  They are seen hugging each other.  Their faces are not shown.  The young woman is wearing a knitted sweater and the young man a t-shirt.
Alternate Title.translated: Make the first move

Item Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você?  [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Martins, Margarida
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nós preocupamo-nos....e você?  [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Poster is part of "Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001" [World Campaign Against AIDS 2001].|~|Additional poster text: "Pode não ser ainda possível curar esta doença - SIDA -, mas é certamente possível, e dever de todos, preveni-la e denunciar sempre a solidão que a cerca." Teresa Salgueiro, Cantora. ["There might not yet be a cure for - AIDS - but it's certainly possible and everyone's duty to prevent it and always denounce the loneliness that comes with it."  Teresa Salgueiro, Singer]|~|Additional poster text: "Nas vossas mãos eu me alimento, nos vossos olhos eu adormeço, com o vosso abraço poderei voltar a sonhar."  Pedro Esteves Hemofilico/Seropositivo. ["In your hands I live on, in your eyes I fall asleep and with your hug I can dream again."  Pedro Esteves, Hemophiliac/HIV-positive.]|~|Poster is part of "...porque a SIDA existe" [...because AIDS exists] campaign.|~|Número Verde: 800 225 115 email: abraco@mail.telepac.pt|~|Additional poster text: "Cuidar dos outros, como gostariamos que cuidassem de nós ."  Carla Sezões Educadora Social do Programa da Abraco de Apoio Domiciliário Dr. José Luís Champalimaud (area metropolitana de Lisboa). ["To take care of others how we would like others to take care of us" Carla Sezoes Social educator of Abraco, home counseling Dr. Jose Luis Champalimaud (metropolitan area of Lisbon).]
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO015.|~|Poster depicts 3 people a man sitting on a chair and two women leaning on the man.  In the background appears the city of Lisbon.  The setting of the picture is the Lisboa Regency Hotel and was taken outdoors.
Alternate Title.translated: We worry about ourselves...and you?
Alternate Title.other: Porque a SIDA existe!|~|Campanha Mundial Contra a SIDA 2001

Item Title: Syphilis. Lass dir nichts anhängen. [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Nardin, Christof|~|Geisler, Thomas
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Syphilis. Lass dir nichts anhängen. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional text in German: “Ungeschützter sex Erhöht das Infektionsrisiko bei Syphilis. Eine Behandelbare Geschlechtskrankheit. Die unbehandelt zum Tod führen kann. Die Syphilis ist wieder da GEH ZUM TEST! Mehr infos unter www.syphilis.at. Eine initiative von Homed. Der verein Homed wurde im Jahr 2000 gegründet und widmet sich unter anderem der Gesundheitsprävention.”Text in English: “Unprotected sex increases the risk of infection with Syphilis. A treatable sexually transmitted disease which untreated can lead to death.  A Homed initiative. Homed Association was founded in the 2000 and is dedicated amongst other things to disease prevention.”
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AU060.|~|Part of a neck and hairy chest of a male who is wearing a green sweater.  He is wearing a gold necklace with a gold charm reading "Syphilis."|~|Date on back of poster, 2006, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Don't let anything be attached to you.

History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AU053.|~|A colorful graphic work depicting a man and woman making love on a sofa, in front of a big window. Their figures are partially obscured by a green plant. On the bottom of the poster in a framed square with an inscription in German "Freigegeben ab 21 Jahren." On the bottom left of the poster a winged bug is hovering next to the “Pleasure Island. Das Anti-Virus-Spiel” phrase..|~|Date on back of poster, 2003, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: Spiel mit mir [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|AIDS (Disease) in women|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: AIDS-Hilfe Wien
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Spiel mit mir [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text on the bottom of the poster: "Freigegeben ab 21 Jahren." English translation: "Free since 21 years old."On the bottom of the poster there is an inscription in both English and German. "Pleasure Island. Das anti-Virus Spiel." English translation of the German text: "The anti-virus play." The website on the poster www.aids.at, includes three computer games about AIDS virus and how to avoid it.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AU052.|~|Poster resembles a frame from a comic book. A young girl wearing only black lingerie is seated seductively with her arms draped over the back of a red sofa. She looks at the viewer invitingly while two open condoms are placed on the sofa and on the floor. The condoms are ready to be used. On the bottom left of the poster winged bug is hovering next to the “Pleasure Island. Das Anti-Virus-Spiel” phrase. This phrase is followed by a website www.aids.at|~|Date on back of poster, 2003, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Play with me

Item Title: Kondome? Na sicher! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)|~|Sexually transmitted diseases|~|Young adults|~|Safe Sex|~|Condoms|~|Awareness|~|Health Knowledge, Attitudes, Practice
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Austria. Bundesministerium für Arbeit, Gesundheit und Soziales
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Kondome? Na sicher! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Das Kondom schützt nicht nur vor AIDS, sondern auch vor Anderen sexuell übertragbaren krank-heiten -- Darum: Komdome? Na sicher! [Condoms protect not only from AIDS, but also from other sexually-transmitted diseases -- therefore: Condom? For sure!]|~|AIDS-Hilfe Wien|~|Graphic, comic book like caption, portraying two boys with an open condom on the table. One of the boys is looking and pointing his forefinger at the viewer. The other boy is standing behind the first boy and winking at the viewer and making a "thumb's up" gesture with his thumb. The round table is high above by the boys' faces. The yellow condom is being presented to the viewers with black color rays on top and the words JUST USE IT in English on the bottom. On the top of the poster beneath the words "Kondome? Na Sicher!" a radiation box (resembling long star) is present with a message in German. The poster seems to target adolescents.|~|Bottom left corner: Herausgeber: BM fur Arbeit, Gesundheit und Soziales, Stubenring 1, 1010 Wien, Sowie aids info AIDS-Hilfen, Bestelltelefon: (01) 711 00 DW 6140
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AU051.|~|Date on back of poster, 2006, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Condom? For sure!

Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AU056.|~|Austrian soccer star Markus Kiesenebner is shown bare-chested facing the viewer. He has a large tattoo of a dragon with presumably Chinese writing on his left arm. The head of the dragon is depicted on his shoulder and the tattoo stretches almost to his forearm.  On the bottom right of the poster two attached condoms, one has an inscription ASK FOR, askö  wien. The inscription is followed by a website www.askoe-wien.at (a sports related website). The other condom has the logo of AIDS HILFE which is a drawing of a outline of a house with the AIDS ribbon on it. The words AIDS HILFE appear on the bottom of the logo.|~|Date on back of poster, 2006, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Always stands tall.

Item Title: Syphilis. Lass dir nichts anhängen. [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.creator: Nardin, Christof|~|Geisler, Thomas
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Syphilis. Lass dir nichts anhängen. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional text in German: “Ungeschützter sex erhöht das Infektionsrisiko bei Syphilis. Eine Behandelbare Geschlechtskrankheit, die unbehandelt zum Tod führen kann. Die Syphilis ist wieder da GEH ZUM TEST! Mehr infos unter www.syphilis.at. Eine initiative von Homed. Der verein Homed wurde im Jahr 2000 gegründet und widmet sich unter anderem der Gesundheitsprävention.”Text in English: “Unprotected sex increases the risk of infection with Syphilis. A treatable sexually transmitted disease which untreated can lead to death.  A Homed initiative. Homed Association was founded in the 2000 and is dedicated amongst other things to disease prevention.”
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AU059.|~|Part of a neck and chest of a female who is wearing a pink wool sweater.  She is wearing a gold necklace with a gold charm spelling out "Syphilis."|~|Date on back of poster, 2006, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Syphilis. Don't let anything be attached to you.

Item Title: Es ist sowieso genug aus Gummi [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Sex
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Es ist sowieso genug aus Gummi [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Auch wenn Mann es gerne verdrängt: Ohne Safer Sex ist das HIV-Risiko um nichts geringer geworden. Ein HIV-AK-Test gibt Gewissheit. Kostenlos und anonym von der Aids Hilfe Wien. Kontakt & Information: http://test.aids.at
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AU066.|~|Poster depicts two men having leather bondage-style sex. One man has Pinocchio-like nose.|~|Part of "Belüg dich nicht selbst! Geh zum test" campaign. English translation: "Don't lie to yourself! Go get tested".
Alternate Title.translated: It is as good as made of rubber anyway
Alternate Title.other: Belüg dich nicht selbst! Geh zum test

Item Title: Lässt nichts durch. [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Austria. Bundesministerium für Bildung, Wissenschaft und Kultur|~|Austria. Bundesministerium für Gesundheit und Frauen|~|Fonds Gesundes Österreich
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Lässt nichts durch. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional text in German on the bottom right of the poster: "Profis haben's einfach drauf." Text in English: "Professionals are always prepared."
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item AU057.|~|Austrian soccer star Helge Payer is shown bare-chested facing the viewer. He plays as a goal keeper, suggesting the importance of behaving defensively to keep the AIDS virus out of your body. He is looking straight at the onlookers and his hands are open in such a way that he is defending his goal.  There is a glowing light behind him, and his hands seem to be holding an invisible soccer ball. Two condoms, still in their packages, are shown on the bottom right of the poster; one has an inscription ASK FOR, askö wien. The inscription is followed by a website www.askoe-wien.at (a sports related website). The other condom has the logo of AIDS HILFE which is a drawing of a outline of a house with the AIDS ribbon on it. The words AIDS HILFE appear on the bottom of the logo.|~|Date on back of poster, 2006, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Does not let anything through.

Title: What should a real Scotsman wear under his kilt?  A condom [incribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text:  National AIDS helplines:  If you have any questions or want to talk to someone you can phone the National Aids Helpline, freephone 0800-567 123;       24 hours a day.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item SC001.|~|The poster shows a male model posing for a portrait dressed in only a kilt.Under the title of the poster there is information for Scottish AIDS Moniter(SAM).  SAM porvides information and education on HIV and AIDS as well as direct services for people with HIV and AIDS.  The National Office is located at 64A Broughton Street, Edinburgh EH1 3SA and their phone number is: 031-557 3885.  The information for the Glasgow office is: 22 Woodside Terrace, Glasgow G3 7XH and their phone number is:  041-353 3133.

Item Title: Wereldwijd 13 miljoen aidswezen [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome|~|Orphans|~|AIDS (Disease)--Africa |~|Children of AIDS patients
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Wereldwijd 13 miljoen aidswezen [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Miriam heeft geen vader en geen moeder meer, alleen een broer en een zus.  Miljoenen aidswezen moeten zichzelf zien redden.  Stop Aids Now! werkt aan zorg, preventie en een vaccin.  Stop Aids Now! is een initiatief van: Aids Fonds, Hivos, ICCO, Memisa en Novib.  Steun de strijd tegen aids, www.StopAidsNow.nl of bel 020 -5287828.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item NE037.|~|Three children are looking down into two graves, presumably those of their parents.|~|Translated additional poster text: Miriam has no father and no mother anymore, only a brother and a sister.  Millions of AIDS orphans must fend for themselves this way.  Stop AIDS Now! is working on care, prevention and a vaccine.  Stop AIDS Now! is an initiative of: Aids Fund, Hivos, ICCO, Memisa and Novib.  Support the fight against AIDS, www.StopAidsNow.nl or call 020 -5287828.|~|Date on back of poster, 2005, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: There are 13 million AIDS orphans worldwide

Item Title: Take care, living positHiv [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome|~|World AIDS Day|~|HIV-positive gay men

Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Take care, living positHiv [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Een actieweek rond Wereld Aids Dag 2001, voor en door de gay-community in Amsterdam.  ma 26 t/m vr 30 november: COC: themafilms rond hiv/aids, acts & performances in de homo-horeca (Havana, SOHO, April, Exit, More, Trut).  za 1 december: Westermarkt: onthulling reuze Red Ribbon, presentatie jongerennetwerk Jongpositief.  di 4 december: Schorerstichting: debat "20 jaar hiv in de scene - hiv verandert (ons)."  Voor programma en informatie kijk op: www.hivnet.org of bel het Aids Fonds, Raoul Fransen: 020-62 62 669.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item NE040.|~|Translated additional poster text: An action on World Aids Day 2001, for and by the gay community in Amsterdam.  Mon. Nov. 26-Fri. Nov. 30: COC: films on the theme of HIV/AIDS, acts and performances in gay clubs (Havana, SOHO, April, Exit, More, Trut).  Sat. Dec. 1: Westermarkt: unveiling giant red ribbon, presentation by the youth network Jongpositief.  Tues. Dec. 4: Schorerstichting: discussing "20 years of HIV in the scene - HIV change (ours)."  For program and information visit: www.hivnet.org or call the Aids Fonds, Raoul Fransen: 020-62 62 669.|~|One man stands behind another, with his arms around the front man.  Only their torsos are visible.  The man in front is wearing a t-shirt with "Take care, living positHiv" on it.  The poster is advertising a program of activities for HIV-positive gay men surrounding World Aids Day.

Item Title: Lang leve de liefde [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Dating (Social custom)
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Lang leve de liefde [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Informatie en tips over verliefd zijn, verkering, seks en veilig vrijen.  Voor al je vragen, www.safesex.nl, over veilig vrijen.  Als je verliefd bent.  En dan is er verkering.  Hoe ver wil je gaan?  Ik vrij veilig, of ik vrij niet.  Wat je moet weten over het condoom en de pil.  Hoe speel je het klaar (om veilig te vrijen)?
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item NE038.|~|Translated additional poster text: Information and tips about love, dating, sex and safe sex. For all your questions, www.safesex.nl, on safe sex.  If you are in love. And then there's dating. How far do you want to go? I have safe sex, or I don't have sex at all. What you need to know about the condom and the pill. How do you manage (to have safe sex)?|~|A female and a male kiss deeply.  The photograph is highly pixellated, as if it were blown up from a magazine.|~|Date on back of poster, 2005, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Long live love

Item Title: Check this out! [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: United States. HIV/AIDS Treatment Information Service
Title: Check this out! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: If you have HIV and are pregnant you could pass the virus to your baby.  Talk to a health care provider or call the HIV/AIDS Treatment Information Service at 1-800-448-0440 or 1-800-243-7012 (TTY service for the deaf) for information on HIV
Description.note: Pink poster with picture of a smiling African American woman.  Poster suggests that HIV positive pregnant women can transmit their virus to the fetus.

Item Title: You can't get HIV here... [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (U.S.)|~|United States. Dept. of Health and Human Services
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: You can't get HIV here... [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: or here...; But you can get HIV/AIDS info in this workplace; HIV hasn't gone away.  Neither have the concerns it raises--like worker morale, discrimination and productivity.  Get free workplace policy and education information.  Check www.hivatwork.org, or call 1-800-458-5231.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US057.|~|Poster depicts a common things found in the work place such as a drinking fountain, a urinal handle, a computer keyboard, and a telephone receiver.  Poster suggests that although you cannot get HIV from any of the things pictured, you can get HIV info at the workplace.|~|Part of "Business responds to AIDS; Labor responds to AIDS" campaign.
Alternate Title.other: Business responds to AIDS; Labor responds to AIDS.

Item Title: Black baby and white baby [descriptive]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Black baby and white baby [descriptive]
Description.inscription: Waarom hij niet?  En hij wel?  Iedereen heeft recht op aidsremmers.  Giro 8957.  Aids Fonds.  Zolang het aidsvirus actief is, zijn wij dat ook.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item NE048.|~|Translated poster text: Why didn't he get them?  And he did?  Everyone has the right to AIDS inhibitors.  Giro 8957.  Aids Fonds.  As long as the AIDS virus is active, we will be, too.|~|Two naked babies sit side by side, one black and one white, with their backs facing us.  The poster implies that the black baby did not get HIV drugs, but the white baby did, and that Aids Fonds is trying to make the drugs available to all.|~|Date on back of poster, 2004, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.

Item Title: HIV@Work [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Employment|~|HIV-positive persons--Conduct of life|~|AIDS (Disease)--Information services|~|HIV-positive persons--Services for
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (U.S.)|~|United States. Dept. of Health and Human Services
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: HIV@Work [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Does the job right; Can-do attitude; Always thinking; Earns respect; Living with HIV; More people are living and working with HIV than ever before; HIV hasn't gone away; Neither have the concerns it raises--like worker morale, discrimination and productivity; Add HIV/AIDS to health and wellness programs and workplace policies.  Everyone benefits.  After all, investing in people is an investment in the future; Get free workplace policy and education information.  Check www.hivatwork.org, or call 1-800-4548-5231; HIV is still in business.
Description.note: Part of "Business responds to AIDS; Labor responds to AIDS" campaign.|~|Poster shows a picture of a male construction worker with arms folded and a stern expression.  Poster suggests that the number of people employed and with HIV is climbing.  There is information available for people with HIV and the workplace.
Alternate Title.other: Business responds to AIDS; Labor responds to AIDS.

Item Title: Faste forhold og løse forbindelser [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: STOP AIDS Århus|~|STOP AIDS (Denmark)|~|STOP AIDS København
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Faste forhold og løse forbindelser [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Grafisk design: Peter Waldorph på foto af Knud Vesterskov.|~|Additional poster text: “Engangsknald og løse partnere? Nej tak, det er ikke lige mig, som tiderne er. Jeg holder mig til en ad gangen.” (Ole, 41) “Kondomer giver en slags frihed, synes jeg. Hvis jeg f.eks. en dag sku’ lave noget ‘forkert,’ sa behøver jeg ikke sige det til min kæreste, lige før vi skal bolle. Det kan jeg vente med, til jeg har lyst. Og uden at få dårlig samvittighed af den grund. Så på en måde synes jeg godt, man kan sige, at kondomer giver mig en slags ‘åndelig’ frihed.” (Svend, 34). Stop AIDS København tlf: 33112911. Stop AIDS Århus tlf: 86128800.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item DK004.|~|Translated additional poster text: “One time hook-ups and loose partners. No thanks, that’s not really me, given the way things are. I keep myself to one at a time.” (Ole, 41). “Condoms give a kind of freedom, I think. If, for example, I do something ‘wrong’ one day, then I don’t have to tell my lover/sweetheart just before we’re going to have sex. I can wait until I want to. And without having a bad conscience because of that. So, in one way, I think you can say that condoms give me a kind of ‘spiritual’ freedom." (Svend, 34).|~|Multicolored blurred images of naked male couples embracing and kissing. Quotes from "Ole" and "Svend" talk about different kinds of sexual behavior in an environment where HIV infection is a risk.
Alternate Title.translated: Stable relationships and loose connections

She urges viewers to learn more about HIV because it happens to everyone, regardless of where they live or their economic status.  She wants viewers to not make the same mistake she did.|~|Part of "America responds to AIDS" campaign.

Item Title: Saunafyre har altid HIV – eller hvad? [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Saunafyre har altid HIV – eller hvad? [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Farlige formodninger? De fleste mænd bruger kondom og glidecreme, når de har sex med en ny partner. Af og til bruger nogle mænd dog andre metoder til at undgå at blive smittet eller at smitte sex-partneren. Nogle prover at gætte sig frem til, om sex-partneren er hiv-smittet eller ej. Det kan være ved at se på hans alder, hvad han gor i sengen, eller hvor man mødte hinanden. Men hverken alder, mødestad eller seksuel erfaring kan fortælle, om en person er smittet med hiv eller ej.|~|Text in bottom left corner of poster: Design: Mikkel Sonne; Foto: Morten Wøldike; Tryk: Eks-Skolens Treykkeri APS.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item DK017.|~|Organization web site: http://www.farligeformodninger.dk|~|Translated additional poster text: Dangerous conjectures? Most men use condoms and lubrication, when they have sex with a new partner. Every now and then some men use other methods to avoid being infected or infecting their sex partner. Some try to guess whether their sex partner is HIV-positive or not. It can be worth it to look at his age, what he does in bed, or how one met. But neither age, meeting place or sexual experience can tell whether a person is HIV-positive or not.|~|A man with a pierced ear and a tattoo on one arm, naked except for a white towel around his waist. His face is shiny and his hair is damp, as though he has just come out of a sauna. A drawing of a heart with an arrow coming out of the top right (modeled on the male symbol?) appears in the top right corner as a logo for the STOP AIDS organization. Poster questions whether gay men who frequent bathhouses are more likely to be HIV-positive, and encourages viewers to avoid making assumptions.|~|Date on back of poster, 2006, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: Sauna guys always have HIV -- or what?

It is vibrant and active, and could be symbolic of an active fight or struggle against AIDS. This may be a print of an actual painting, since there seems to be a canvas texture that shows through, and there are brush strokes in the blue area (sky?).

Item Title: AIDS e comunità locale: quale prevenzione? [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Mantua (Italy : Province).  Amministrazione provinciale|~|Servizio tossicodipendenze commissione AIDS
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: AIDS e comunità locale: quale prevenzione? [inscribed]
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item IT016.|~|This poster announces an exhibit and a conference, held in 4 different towns in the province of Mantua, Italy, over the course of 4 weeks in October 1993. The exhibits were held in 4 separate towns, one week at a time from Oct. 4 through Oct. 31.  The conference took place over 4 Saturdays, from Oct. 9 through Oct. 30.  Conference speakers were priests and doctors, and are named on the poster.|~|In the center of the poster is a line drawing representing a brick wall labelled AIDS being uplifted and broken in two by two intertwined  raised arms and hands. The arms are rooted like trees, and the roots are shown within a space shaped like a heart.|~|Date on back of poster, 1993, reflects when the vendor received the copy later acquired by the UCLA Library.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS and the local community: what types of prevention?

Item Title: Creemos en Dios.  Creemos que el sexo es sagrado.  Creemos en cuidar el uno al otro.  Creemos en el uso del condón. [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Condom use|~|AIDS (Disease)--Religious aspects--Catholic Church.|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention--Moral and ethical aspects.
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Catholics for a Free Choice (Organization)|~|Public Media Center (U.S.)
