Item Title: Nokpote=discrimination [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|AIDS (Disease)--Risk factors|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control|~|Condoms
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nokpote=discrimination [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Etre safe, ce n’est pas sélectionner ses partenaires en fonction de leur test VIH.Etre safe, ce n’est pas baiser sans capote parce qu’on pense que son partenaire est lui aussi séronégatif. Etre safe, ce n’est pas baiser sans capote parce qu’on pense que son partenaire est lui aussi séropositif.Etre safe, c'est tenir à la vie, éviter les contaminations et les surcontaminations.Etre safe, c'est préférer ses maris et ses amants vivants. Etre safe, c’est mettre des capotes a chaque fois. Choisir son partenaire selon son statut sérologique, c’est de la discrimination.
Description.note: Translated poster text: To be safe, do not select partners based on their HIV test.To be safe, do not fuck without condoms because you think your partner is also HIV negative. To be safe, do not fuck without condoms because you think your partner is also HIV positive. To be safe is to hold on to life, avoiding infections and reinfections. To be safe is to prefer that husbands and lovers live. To be safe is to use condoms every time. To choose your partners based only on their HIV status is discrimination.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR267.|~|Poster presents some advice for safety in relationships and awareness of HIV. "NoKpote" (or "no capote") also seems to refer to bareback sex, or sex without condoms.
Alternate Title.translated: No condom=discrimination.

Item Title: SIDA: bientot la parité a quand l'égalité [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--France|~|AIDS (Disease)--Social aspects|~|AIDS (Disease)--Study and teaching|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: SIDA: bientot la parité a quand l'égalité [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: En France, les fémmes représentent 42% des nouvelles contaminations. Il est urgent de renforcer la promotion et l'accessibilité des préservatifs. Dans le monde, 48% des séropositifs sont des séropositives. Il est inacceptable que la recherche ne s'occupe pas des conséquences du virus et des traitements sur le corps des femmes.
Description.note: Translated note: In France, women account for 42% of new infections. It is urgent to strengthen the promotion and accessibility of condoms. Worldwide, 48% of HIV positives are HIV positive women. It is unacceptable that the research does not address the consequences of HIV and its treatment on women's bodies.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR268.|~|Poster has the symbol for women and a question mark  emphasizing on women related AIDS disease and some statistics. Poster also presents an advertisment about protesting against AIDS in Saint-Denis and Strasburg (France) on November 2007.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS: Soon parity, when equality.|~|Global day fight against AIDS. Protesting Friday November 30th 07 6.30 Porte Saint-Denis M Strasbourg-Saint-Denis.
Alternate Title.inscribed: Journée mondiale de lutte contre le SIDA. Manifestnos Vendredi 30 Novembre 07 18H30 Porte Saint-Denis M Strasbourg-Saint-Denis.

Item Title: Vivre seule ou mourir [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Vivre seule ou mourir [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Le project de loi Hortefeux sur l'immigration restreint encore le regroupement familial en instaurant des conditions particulièrement discriminatoires. Les étrangèrEs atteintEs de pathologies graves comme le sida n'ont plus qu'une alternative : être condamnéEs á rester seulEs en France pour se soigner ou mourir auprès de leurs proches dans leur pays d'origine, faute de traitements disponibles.
Description.note: Poster depicts a naked woman from the waist up, with her arms crossed over her chest (partially hiding her breasts). Her posture suggests hopelessness. Poster also has information on the Hortefeux law in France which affects immigrants.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR269.|~|Translated poster text: The project of the Hortefeux immigration law further restricts the family by creating particularly discriminatory conditions. Foreign women suffering from serious diseases like AIDS have only one alternative: to be doomed to remain alone in France to heal or die with their relatives in their country of origin, lacking of available treatments.
Alternate Title.translated: Live alone or die.

Item Title: SIDA: Combien coûtent nos vies? [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Personal or Corporate Name.subject: Sarkozy, Nicolas, $d 1955-|~|UMP (Political party)
Title: SIDA: Combien coûtent nos vies? [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: La droite agresse les plus précaires, les plus vulnérables, les plus malades. La santé n'a pas de prix, mais elle a un coût. C'est le leitmotiv du gouvernement, de l'UMP [Union pour un Mouvement Populaire]. À combiene estiment-ils notre santé? Combien coûtent nos vies? À ces questions obscènes, à ceux qui pensent et disent que la santé est un luxe. la réponse collective que nous devons leur opposer est simple: nos vies ne coûteront jamais trop cher.
Description.note: Translation text: The right attacks the most precarious, the most vulnerable, the sickest. Health is priceless, but it has a cost. This is the leitmotif of the government, the UMP [Union for a Popular Movement]. How much do they value our health? How much are our lives worth? To these obscene questions, to those who think and say that health is a luxury, the collective response of those in opposition is simple: our lives will never cost too much.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR272.|~|Description note: Poster presentes an event with time and place of gathering in France regarding AIDS in 2004.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS: How much are our lives worth?|~|December 1st 2004 : Event, departure Barbès-Rochechouart at 7 pm. Join us.
Alternate Title.inscribed: 1er Décembre 2004: Manifestation, départ de Barbès-Rochechouart à 19 heures. Rejoignes-nous!

Item Title: Nicolas Sarkozy, 2007-2012, nous n'y survivrons pas et vous non plus [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Personal or Corporate Name.subject: Sarkozy, Nicolas, $d 1955-|~|UMP (Political party)
Title: Nicolas Sarkozy, 2007-2012, nous n'y survivrons pas et vous non plus [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additonal poster text: La santé pour Nicolas Sarkozy c'est: l’instauration d'une franchise illimitée sur les soins; le déremboursement de médicaments; la remise en cause de la prise en charge à 100% des séropositifVEs; la dérégulation du système hospitalier public; l’expulsion de malades étrangerEs dans des pays ou ils/elles mourront faute de traitements; l’absence d’engagement pour le financement par la France de la lutte contre le sida dans le monde. Nicolas Sarkozy et l'UMP [Union pour un Mouvement Populaire] nous promettent une politique de santé encore plus inégalitaire et discriminatoire. Nous ny survivrons pas.
Description.note: Translated text: Health for Nicolas Sarkozy is: establishment of an unlimited franchise for care; the delisting of drugs; the challenge to support 100% of people living with HIV; the deregulation of the public hospital system; the expulsion of foreign patients to countries where they will die for lack of treatment; the absence of commitment for financing from France to fight against AIDS worldwide. Nicolas Sarkozy and the UMP [Union for a Popular Movement] are promising a health policy even more unequal and discriminatory. We will not survive it.|~|Description note: Poster has drawing of a skull and cross bones with Nikolas Sarkozy's name on the top. It describes the UMP party (Union pour un Mouvement Populaire = Union for a Popular Movement) in France has lots of negative effects for health care system.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR273.
Alternate Title.translated: Nicolas Sarkozy, 2007-2012, we do not survive and neither will you.

Item Title: SIDA. Politique sécuritaire: catastophe sanitaire [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: SIDA. Politique sécuritaire: catastophe sanitaire [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Le gouvernement a pris pour cible les prostituées, les étrangers, les usagers de drogue et les précaires et s’apprête á leur rendre impossible tout accès a la prévention, à la santé et aux droits sociaux. La santé est incompatible avec la répression. Chirac, Raffarin, Sarkozy, Perben ou Mattéi le savent. Ils ont choisi. En 6 mois, ils ont anéanti des années de lutte contre le sida. Ils veulent nous réduire au silence, même si cela doit signifier notre mort. www.actupp.org|~|Poster text: Le 1er Décembre, Journée Mondiale de Luite Contre le SIDA, manifestez avec ACT UP-Paris pour la santé, contre la repression. Départ à 15 heures, métro Barbès.
Description.note: Translated additional poster text: The government has targeted prostitutes,foreigners, drug users and the vulnerable, and is about to render impossible any access to prevention, health, and social rights. Health care is incompatible with repression. Chirac, Raffarin, Sarkozy, Perben, or Mattéi know. They chose. In six months, they destroyed years of fighting against AIDS. They want to reduce us to silence, even if it means our death. www.actupp.org|~|Description note: Poster shows a drawing of Nicolas Sarkozy, four soldiers, a handcuff and a dead body on the ground. Poster also presents a day of gatheirng in Paris for global day against AIDS with time and place of gathering.|~|Translated poster text: December 1st, World AIDS Day, demonstrate with ACT UP-Paris for health, against repression. Departure at 3 pm, métro Barbès.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS. Security policy: health disaster.

Title: Modes de transmission [inscribed]

First section includes three parts: Picture of a sick person lying in bed with infusion, picture of infusion apparatus with a dot in it, which represents some kind of infection, and image of a drop, which probably also represents infection. Second section consists of a picture of two men and a woman using drugs, picture of syringe with a dot in it, which represents some kind of infection, and picture of a drop. Third section depicts pregnant woman sitting on a bench, picture of fetus inside of a female body with a dot on placenta, which represents infection, and image of a drop. Last section includes picture of naked man and woman that hug each other, image of a male and female genitalia with secretions with a dot, which represents some kind of infection, and picture of a drop. Poster is drawn black and white.|~|Poster number 6 in series: " Le SIDA, 12 affiches pour en parler."|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. Item Title: C'est Pierrot, il a eu chaud [inscribed]
Subject.descriptiveTopic: Medical personnel|~|Bars|~|Beds|~|Men|~|Medicines|~|Medical equipment & supplies|~|Women|~|Testing|~|Smiling|~|Sick persons|~|Singing|~|Hypodermic syringes|~|Telephones|~|Calendars|~|Medical offices|~|Vending machines|~|Infusion therapy

Title: C'est Pierrot, il a eu chaud [inscribed]
Description.note: Poster number 7 in series: " Le SIDA, 12 affiches pour en parler."|~|Poster tells a story in pictures. On the first one the man Pierrot is sitting in the bar with his friends. On the second picture he is visiting a sick man, who is lying in the bed with infusion. On the next one Pierrot is sitting in the doctor’s office with worry expression on his face. Then the nurse is taking his blood to do the test. The calendar on the wall shows that the date is May 3rd. On the next picture Pierrot is visiting doctor again possibly to find out what the blood test result. The date on the calendar is May 18th. The doctor gives him some papers to read and possibly telling him to be careful. On the next picture Pierrot possibly buying condoms from the vending-machine. Then the nurse is taking his blood for blood test again. The calendar in the nurse’s office shows that the date is August 3rd, which means that 3 month have passed by. On the next picture Pierrot is sitting in the doctor’s office. The date on the calendar is August 18th. The doctor is smiling, which possibly means that Pierrot doesn’t have anything serious. On the last picture Pierrot is going with the little box of medication and singing. Poster is drawn black and white.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR287.
Alternate Title.translated: This is Pierrot, he was hot

Title: Triste historie de M. Rouletabille [inscribed]
Description.note: Poster number 8 in series: " Le SIDA, 12 affiches pour en parler."|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR288.|~|Poster tells a story in pictures. On the first picture two men are sitting in the restaurant and drinking alcohol. The waitress is bringing cake. The name of one of them is Mr. Rouletabille. There are trucks can be seen in the window of the restaurant, so the men possibly are truck drivers. On the second picture Mr. Rouletabille sitting with his wife and child in the living room and watching TV. The program that they are watching is about AIDS. The big letters “AIDS” are on the screen. On the next picture Mr. Rouletabille is sitting in the doctor’s office and talking to the doctor. Then nurse is taking his blood for the test. On the next picture Mr. Rouletabille is sitting in the doctor’s office again and crying. Possibly doctor had told him the bad news, that he has AIDS. Then doctor makes physical exam of Mr. Rouletabille. On the next picture the nurse is taking the blood for test from Mrs. Rouletabille. Then Mr. Rouletabille possibly is buying condoms from the vending-machine in the store. His child is standing nearby and drinking soda. On the next picture Mr. Rouletabille is working, driving the truck. Then Mr. Rouletabille is sitting in the wheelchair and the nurse is taking him to the doctor. After that Mr. Rouletabille is driving the truck again, but now he looks very sick. On the last picture Mr. Rouletabille is lying in the bed in the hospital with infusion. His wife is standing near him and handing his hand. Poster is drawn black and white.
Alternate Title.translated: Sad story of Mr. Rouletabille

On the first picture young woman is looking on the baby clothes in the store window. On the second picture the same woman is sitting in the gynecologist’s office, the woman is pregnant. Then the nurse is taking woman’s blood for testing. On the next picture the women is sitting in the office of another doctor and crying. Possibly the doctor had told her the bad news that she is HIV positive. On the next picture the woman is sitting with her husband on a couch at home, and her husband is trying to calm her down and show her his support by touching her shoulder. On the next picture nurse is taking blood from the husband’s hand for testing. Then he is buying condoms from the vending-machine. On the next picture the same young woman feeding a baby with milk from a bottle. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR301.
Alternate Title.translated: Women prefer men who know how to protect them

Item Title: Si vous vous faites tout un roman de votre première fois, voici les premières lignes [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Australie (Firm)|~|France. $b Ministère de la santé publique et de l'assurance maladie
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Si vous vous faites tout un roman de votre première fois, voici les premières lignes [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Translated poster text: This summer, it will be perhaps the first time. The inexperience, emotion, and a certain apprehension may be disconcerting during your first intercourse. There is no need to have dozens of experiments to test or to experience pleasure ; hugs, kisses, discovering the body of another, are all sources. The condom does not necessarily make things easy, but it's important to talk about it before and use it right the first time and every time thereafter. This is the most effective way to protect yourselves from the AIDS virus (HIV) and sexually transmitted diseases (STDs). It is also a means of contraception. But mostly, it's  a proof of love. To speak to someone about it, call Youth Health at 05.235.236. AIDS Info Service and 05.36.66.36. Protect yourself from AIDS.|~|Additional poster text: Cet été, ce sera peut-être la premiére fois. L'inexpérience, l'émotion, une certaine appréhension peuvent décontenancer lors d'un premier rapport sexuel. Nul besoin d'avoir eu des dizaines d'expériences pour éprouver ou faire éprouver du plaisir ; caresses, baisers, découverte du corps de l'autre en sont autant de sources . Le préservatif ne facilite pas forcément les choses. Mais c'est important d'en parler avant, de l'utiliser dès la première fois et à chaque fois ensuite. C'est le moyen le plus efficace de se protéger du virus du sida (VIH) et des maladies sexuellement transmissibles (MST). C'est aussi un moyen de contraception. C'est surtout une preuve d'amour. Pour en parler, Fil Santé Jeunes au 05.235.236. et Sida Info Service au 05.36.66.36.
Description.note: Poster shows a black & white photo of the faces of a man and a woman kissing. His hand is on her face. At the bottom of the poster, there is an orange condom.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR302.
Alternate Title.translated: If you get a whole novel on your first time, here are the first lines

Item Title: S’aimer, s’aider et ne jamais céder [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.sponsor: Association des médecins gais|~|Center for Attitudinal Healing (Tiburon, Calif.)|~|Aides (Association)|~|Syndicat national des entreprises gaies|~|American Association of Pharmaceutical Scientists|~|Association des Jeunes Contre le Sida|~|Centre Gai et Lesbien|~|CFH (Organization)|~|Comité Gay Paris Ile de France|~|Radio FG 98.2|~|Sante et plaisir Gai (Organization)|~|ARCAT-SIDA|~|Actions Traitements (Paris)|~|ADIS 85 (Organization)|~|David et Jonathan (Organization)|~|Patchwork des noms (Organization)|~|Tours Elisa 2000 (Oganization)|~|Gay'titudes (Organization)|~|Lesbian & Gay Pride (Organization)|~|Vaincre le Sida (Organization)
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: S’aimer, s’aider et ne jamais céder [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Aujourd’hui, on peut être séropositif et envisager l’avenir. On peut être séropositif et faire des projets, des rencontres, s’épanouir à travers son travail, ses amis, sa famille ou son entourage.Il faut penser à demain, penser que le combat contre la maladie avance. Penser à soi en se protégeant, penser aux autres en les protégeant, penser au passé car on n'oubliera jamais ceux qui nous ont quittés.Ensemble, plus solidaires, mieux informés et plus conscients de notre santé, on est plus forts pour résister, plus unis pour s’entraider.Pour en savoir plus et en parler: Sida info service 05 36 66 36 service confidentiel et gratuit 24H/24|~|Translated poster text: Today, we can be HIV positive and look ahead. We can be HIV positive and make plans, meetings and grow at work, with friends and family. We must think about tomorrow and think that the fight against the disease progresses. Think about and protect ourselves, think of others and protect them, think about the past because we will never forget those who have left us. Overall, the more cohesive, better informed and aware of our health, the stronger we are to resist, unite, and to help each other.To learn more and talk about: AIDS Info Service 05 36 66 36 free and confidential service 24 hours.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR303.
Alternate Title.translated: Love, help and never give up.

Description.note: A young black man and woman stand facing the viewer, embracing.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item FR312.
Alternate Title.translated: We decided to get tested for AIDS

Item Title: Farbe bekennen! Welt-Aids-Tag 1. Dezember [Inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Patients--Social networks|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome|~|World AIDS Day
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Farbe bekennen! Welt-Aids-Tag 1. Dezember [Inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Die Rote Schleife (Red Ribbon) steht weltweit als Symbol für die Solidarität mit Menschen, die von Aids als Infizierte, Erkrankte, Gefährdete, Angehörige oder Freunde besonders betroffen sind. Mit der Roten Schleife zeigen Sie Ihre Anteilnahme und Engagement. Ihre Spende unterstützt ganz praktisch die schwierige Arbeit der Aids-Stiftung, Aids-Hilfen oder anderer Organisationen, die sich für Menschen mit HIV und Aids einsetzen. Dafür herzlichen Dank.
Description.note: Multiple gray silhouettes of male and female figures are interspersed with red-tinted photographs of men and woman against a white background. A large red AIDS ribbon appears in the upper right corner. Poster suggests wearing the AIDS ribbon on World AIDS Day to show support for and solidarity with people living with AIDS.|~|Translated additional poster text: The Red Ribbon is recognized as the symbol of solidarity with people who are infected with, ill with or endangered by AIDS, or the friends who are affected by it. Show your concern and commitment with the red ribbon. Your donation supports virtually all the hard work of the AIDS Foundation, AIDS support groups or other organizations used by people with HIV and AIDS. Many thanks for that.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW263.
Alternate Title.translated: Show your colors! World AIDS Day December 1

Item Title: Wichtigste Zutat! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Wichtigste Zutat! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Manche Menschen lassen etwas Entscheidendes weg: das schützende Kondom. Deshalb infizieren sich in Deutschland täglich 7 Menschen mit HIV. Eine HIV-Infektion heißt: ständige Angst vor Aids und ein einschneidender Verlust an Lebensqualität. Entscheiden Sie sich für Ihre Gesundheit! Es lohnt sich!
Description.note: Translated additional poster text: Some people leave out something crucial: the protective condom. Therefore, 7 people are infected with HIV in Germany daily. An HIV infection means constant fear of AIDS and a drastic loss of quality of life. Choose your health! It's worth it!|~|Photo depicts a leek, with the root end encased in a condom.|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW264.
Alternate Title.translated: Most important ingredient.

Item Title: Gegen Kurzsichtigkeit! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|Sexually transmitted diseases--Prevention
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Gegen Kurzsichtigkeit! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Etwas gesunder Weitblick fördert den Spaß am Sex. Denn wer immer und überall Kondome benutzt, ist immer und überall vor sexuell übertragbaren Krankheiten geschützt. So bleiben Ihnen unnötige Sorgen erspart - und der Genuss auf lange Sicht erhalten!
Description.note: Translated additional poster text: Somewhat healthy farsightedness promotes fun sex. After all, those who always and everywhere use condoms are always protected against sexually transmitted diseases. Thus you are spared unnecessary worry -- and receive the benefit in the long term!|~|Photo depicts a carrot with its tip encased in a condom.|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW265.
Alternate Title.translated: Against myopia!

Item Title: Keine faulen Ausreden! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Sexually transmitted diseases--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Keine faulen Ausreden! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Manche erzählen alles Mögliche, um kein Kondom benutzen zu müssen. Doch die wachsenden Gefahren durch Aids und andere sexuell übertragbare Krankheiten sprechen für sich. Machen Sie deshalb keine faulen Kompromisse, sondern Kondome zur Selbstverständlichkeit!
Description.note: Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Photo depicts two bananas. One, which looks healthy, is encased in a condom. The other, which is brown and overripe, does not have a condom.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW266.|~|Additional translated poster text: Some say everything possible to avoid having to use a condom. But the growing risk of AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases speak for themselves. Therefore, do not make bad compromises, but take  condoms for granted!
Alternate Title.translated: No lame excuses!

Item Title: NO IMAGE (GW_267)
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: NO IMAGE (GW_267)
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW267.

Item Title: Sicher querbeet! [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Sicher querbeet! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Gerade bei wechselnden Partnern sind Kondome unverzichtbar. Denn in Deutschland infizieren sich täglich immer noch sieben Menschen mit HIV. Deshalb gilt: mit wem Sie es auch machen -- greifen Sie zum schützenden Gummi!
Description.note: Translated additional poster text: Especially with different partners, condoms are essential. For in Germany seven people are still infected with HIV every day. Bottom line: whoever you're doing it with --reach for a protective rubber!|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW268.
Alternate Title.translated: Security all over!

Item Title: Poppt sicher! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Sexually transmitted diseases--Prevention|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control|~|Pregnancy
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Poppt sicher! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Wer seinen Spaß haben will, sollte ein Kondom dabei haben. Denn das Gummi schützt gleich mehrfach: Vor HIV/Aids, vor einer ungewollten Schwangerschaft und vor sexuell übertragbaren Krankheiten wie Chlamydien, Hepatitis, Feigwarzen oder Herpes. Deshalb lohnt sich Safer Sex in jedem Fall!
Description.note: Translated additional poster text: Whoever wants to have fun should have a condom. Because the rubber protects several ways: against HIV/AIDS, an unwanted pregnancy, and sexually transmitted diseases such as chlamydia, hepatitis, genital warts, or herpes. This is why safer sex is always worthwhile!|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW269.
Alternate Title.translated: Pops for sure!

Item Title: Passt auf jede Gurke! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Condoms
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Passt auf jede Gurke! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Ein Kondom ist so elastisch, dass es fast immer perfekt passt. Und falls das Standard-Gummi nicht optimal sitzt: Selbst für Ausnahmegrößen gibt es passende Modelle. Das macht Sex für jeden sicher und entspannt. Auch für Sie!
Description.note: Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Translated additional poster text: A condom is so elastic that it almost always fits perfectly. And if the standard-sized rubber doesn't fit, there are appropriate models for exceptional sizes. That makes sex secure and relaxed. For you too!|~|Photo depicts three cucumbers of different sizes, all encased in condoms.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW270.
Alternate Title.translated: Take care of each cucumber!

Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW271.

Item Title: Auch für junges Gemüse! [Inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Auch für junges Gemüse! [Inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Übung macht den Meister. Und Informationen machen schlau. Gerade junge Menschen sollten rechzeitig wissen, wie man Kondome richtig benutzt. Denn sexuell übertragbare Krankheiten wie HIV/Aids, Chlamydien, Hepatitis, Feigwarzen oder Herpes machen keinen Halt vor dem Nachwuchs!
Description.note: Translated additional poster text: Practice makes perfect, and information makes wise. Young straight people should know how to use condoms correctly. Sexually communicable diseases such as HIV / AIDS, chlamydia, hepatitis, genital warts or herpes, do not stop for the new generation.|~|Images shows various vegetables with condoms put on them.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW273.|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].
Alternate Title.translated: Also for young vegetables!

Item Title: Gemeinsame Sache! [Inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Condoms|~|AIDS (Disease)--Germany
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Gemeinsame Sache! [Inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Verhütung ist Männersache. Denken Sie deshalb beide ans Kondom! Noch heute infizieren sich in Deutschland täglich siebenMenschen mit HIV. Kondome schützen vor HIV/AIDS und anderen sexuell übertragbaren Krankheiten -- undzwar beide Partner.
Description.note: Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Translated additional poster text: Prevention is not just something for men. Both should think about the condom. Every day in Germany seven people contract HIV. Condoms protect both partners against HIV/AIDS and other sexual diseases.|~|Image depicts a cucumber and a squash with condoms placed on them.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW274.
Alternate Title.translated: Common cause!

Item Title: Stark bleiben! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Sexually transmitted diseases--Prevention|~|Condom use|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|Sex education
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Stark bleiben! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Lassen Sie sich nicht von falschen Argumenten verführen: Kondome sd immer noch der beste schutz vor HIV und anderen sexuell übertragbaren krankheiten. Und das ist Grund genug sich für safer sex stark zu machen.|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].
Description.note: Image shows a number of bananas with multi-colored condoms put on them.|~|Translated additional poster text:Do not be seduced by false arguments: Condoms are still the best protection against HIV and other sexual diseases. And that is reason enough to stand up for safer sex.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW275.
Alternate Title.translated: Stay strong!

Item Title: Sicher macht lustig! [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|Safe Sex|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control|~|Condoms
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Sicher macht lustig! [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Mit HIV und Aids ist nicht zu spaßen. Deshalb: Sprechen Sie mit Ihrer Partnerin oder Ihrem Partner über Safer Sex und gehen Sie zusammen auf Entdeckungsreise. Im buntenKondomsortiment findet sich für jeden das Richtige. So können Sie sich mit einem sicheren Gefühl gemeinsam vergnügen.
Description.note: Translated additional poster text:HIV and AIDS are no joking matter. Therefore: Talk with your partner about safer sex and go together to explore. The colorful condom assortment has something for everyone. Thus, have fun together with a secure feeling. Listen and Read Carefully|~|Image shows a lemon with a blue condom on it.|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW276.
Alternate Title.translated: Safety makes it fun!

Item Title: Steht jedem!
Subject.conceptTopic: Safe sex in AIDS prevention|~|Safe Sex|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control|~|Condoms
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Steht jedem!
Description.inscription: Additional poster text:Mit Gummi steht man immer gut da. Denn Kondome schützen vor HIV und anderen sexuell übertragbaren Krankheiten. Das macht den Sex für alle Beteiligten viel unbeschwerter -- und steigert mit Sicherheit ihr gutes Gefühl danach!
Description.note: Translated additional poster text:They always have a good time with a rubber. Because condoms protect against HIV and other sexually transmitted diseases. That makes the sex for all parties involved much more easy - and safe with their good sense|~|Part of two public AIDS campaigns in Germany: Gib AIDS keine Chance [Don't give AIDS a chance], and Mach's mit [Join in].|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item GW277.
Alternate Title.translated: If everyone!

Item Title: SIDA Teste. [inscribed]

Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Onde fazer o teste VIH/Sida?Pode fazer o teste de rastreio gratuito, anónimo e sem marcação, de segunda a sexta feira, das 7h00 às 20h00, no Centro Hospitalario do Luxemburgo (rue Barblé) e de segunda a sexta-feira, das 7h30 às 16h00 no Laboratório Nacional de Saúde (rue du Laboratoire)[Where to get tested for HIV/AIDS?You can get tested anonymously and without identifier, during the second to sixth fairs, from 7:00 to 20:00, at the Centro Hospitalario do Luxemburgo (Barblé street) and from the second to sixth fair, from 7:30 ]|~|É importante saber![It is important to know!]
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item LU014.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS Test.

Item Title: SIDA. Le test [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: SIDA. Le test [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text. Ou faire le test HIV/Sida. Vous pouvez effectuer un test gratuit, anonyme et sans rendez-vous, du lundi au vendredi de 7h00 a 20h00 heures au Centre Hospitalier de Luxembourg (CHL), et du lundi au vendredi de 7h30 a 16h00 heures au Laboratoire National de Sante. [Or take the HIV/AIDS test. You can test free, anonymous and without an appointment, Monday through Friday from 7:00 to 20:00 at the Centre Hospitalier de Luxembourg (CHL), and from Monday to Friday from 7:30 to 16:00 at the Laboratoire National de Additional poster text. O ù faire le test HIV/Sida. Vous pouvez effectuer un test gratuit, anonyme et sans rendez-vous, du lundi au vendredi de 7h00 à 20h00 heures au Centre Hospitalier de Luxembourg (CHL), et du lundi au vendredi de 7h30 à 16h00 heures au Laboratoire National de Santé.[
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item LU015.

Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Hepatitis B. Errug besmettelijk. Errug vervelend. Errug gevaarlijk. Laat je vaccineren. Simpel, veilig, gratis. Ga naar www.homohep.nl voor meer informatie, en maak (online) een afspraak, of bel de ggd.|~|Translated additional poster text: Hepatitis B. Contagious is back. Annoying is back. Dangerous is back. Description.note: The words are in red on top of a camouflage background with a gun sight.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item NE057.

Item Title: Na cama comigo, só com preservativo. [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Na cama comigo, só com preservativo. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Harmony. Amor Com Segurança. Colabora com a Abraço.ABRAÇO... porque a SIDA existe![HARMONY.Love with assurance.Help Abraço.ABRAÇO... because AIDS exists.]
Description.note: Poster composed of three pictures arranged horizontally. With the first one showing three people in a bed with what seems wine glasses in hand. The logos for Harmony and ABRAÇO at the left and lower corners of the picture respectively. Second picture is basically the same but with a young woman in the bed holding a bunch of condoms inflated like balloons.  Same for the last picture, with this one having two young women in a bed with a big cardboard box in front of them and one trowing codom packets into the air. Both are smiling.  A picture of photographer Tingo Brarens appears in the lower left corner of the poster. He is holding his camera, which has a condom over the lens.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO023.
Alternate Title.translated: To bed with me, only with a condom

Item Title: É altura de ensinar as crianças a viver num mundo com SIDA
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome|~|Awareness|~|Children of AIDS patients
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: É altura de ensinar as crianças a viver num mundo com SIDA
Description.inscription: Algumas pessoas com SIDA, álem de terem o vírus, têm filhos. São milhares de crianças e adolescentes que ficam sem os pais, sem amor e sem recursos. Só não podemos permitir que eles percam a esperança.[Some people with AIDS, besides having the virus, also have children. There are thousands of children and adolescents that have no parents, no love, or resources. We can't allow them to lose hope.]
Description.note: A childlike drawing done with crayolas shows a childish figure standing on a tuft of grass, over the word "eu" (me). There are two tufts of grass nearby over the words "pai" (father) and "mãe" (mother). The absence of any figures over those words suggests that the child has lost his or her parents to AIDS.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item PO024.
Alternate Title.translated: It is time to teach children to live in a world with AIDS.

Item Title: Non si tratta di combattere i malati di AIDS. Si tratta di sconfiggere l'AIDS. [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|World AIDS Day|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Non si tratta di combattere i malati di AIDS. Si tratta di sconfiggere l'AIDS. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: la giornata mondiale dell'AIDS non è una giornata festiva, ma di impegno solidale per ricordarci che il problema dell'AIDS è lungi dall'essere risolto. Chi emargina le persone sieropositive e i malati di AIDS crea dei confini illusori. Per fermare il virus dobbiamo farlo insieme. Per esempio, utilizzando sempre il preservativo nei nuovi rapporti sessuali. Proteggi il tuo prossimo come te stesso.|~|Translated poster text: World AIDS Day is not a public holiday, but a commitment of solidarity to remember that the problem of AIDS is far from resolved. The disease marginalizes people living with HIV and AIDS and it creates illusory boundaries. To stop the virus we must do it together. For example, by always using condoms in new sexual relationships. Protect your neighbor as yourself.
Description.note: Poster shows a stack of papers with a sheet on top that describes the summary of measures taken by individual countries against international travelers about the screening test for HIV. A breif article about New Zealand is highlighted, cut out, and paperclip in front of it.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item SZ072.
Alternate Title.translated: This is not to fight AIDS. This is to defeat AIDS

Item Title: Ne tournez pas le dos au SIDA [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Social acceptance|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS|~|World AIDS Campaign
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Ne tournez pas le dos au SIDA [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text:Chacun d'entre nous peut contribuer à stopper la propagation du vih et à réduire l'impact du sida. Vous n'avez pas besoin d'être un scientifique de haut niveau travaillant sur un remde pour faire la différence. Vous protéger et protéger les autres de l'infection à vih, accueillir dans votre vie quelqu'un qui vit avec le vih ou encore simplement parler du vih et du sida peuvent aider. Allez-vous passer à l'action?Faites une promesse dès maintenant sur www.worldaidscampaign.org
Description.note: Translated additional poster text:Each of us can help stop the spread of HIV and reduce the impact of AIDS. You do not need to be a senior scientist working on a remedy to make a difference. Protect yourself and others from HIV infection, welcome in your life someone living with HIV or simply talk about HIV and AIDS can help. Will you take action?Make a promise now www.worldaidscampaign.org|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA017.|~|The poster shows a woman wearing clothes of Indian tradition. She is sitting with her back toward the viewer.
Alternate Title.translated: Don't turn your back to HIV

Item Title: Asume el liderazgo. [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|World AIDS Day|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS|~|World AIDS Campaign|~|Ford Foundation
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Asume el liderazgo. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Los lideres mundiales prometieron proporcionar, para el año 2010, acceso universal a la prevención y apoyo relacionados con el VIH.  A pesar de ello, más personas que nunca se están infectando por el VIH y sólo una pequeña parte de quienes necesitan tratamiento lo reciben. Es hora de exigir responsabilidades a nuestros líderes. Asume el liderazgo. Exigo acción.  Detén el SIDA.  Mantén la promesa.|~|Translated additional poster text: The world leaders pledged to provide, by 2010, universal access to prevention and HIV support. However, more people than ever are becoming infected with HIV and only a small part of those who need treatment receive it. It's time to demand accountability from our leaders. Take the Lead. Demands action. Stop AIDS. Keep the Promise.
Description.note: Image of an AIDS ribbon being placed in a ballot box.  Poster suggests that society needs to take the lead in AIDS/HIV prevention and control and to not wait for politicians to do things.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA018.
Alternate Title.translated: Take the lead.

Item Title: Asume el liderazgo. [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS|~|World AIDS Campaign|~|Ford Foundation
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Asume el liderazgo. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Translated additional poster text: Take the Lead. To achieve universal access to prevention, treatment, care and support related to HIV by the year 2010, leadership is needed at all levels. Leadership begins in schools and in families, in places of work and worship. Be a leader wherever you are. Stop AIDS. Keep the Promise.|~|Additional poster text: Para lograr el acceso universal a la prevención, tratamiento, atención y apoyo relacionados con el VIH para el año 2010, se necesita liderazgo en todos niveles.  El liderazgo empieza en las escuelas y en las familias, en los lugares de trabajo y de culto.  Sé un lider alli donde estés.  Detén el SIDA.  Mantén la promesa.
Description.note: On a purple background, four white silhouettes reaching for a red ribbon.  One silhouette has jumped and grabbed the ribbon.  The poster suggests that in order to prevent HIV and AIDS, one must take a leadership role and take initiative instead of waiting for others to do it.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA019.
Alternate Title.translated: Take the lead.

Item Title: Deliver [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: HIV Infections--therapy|~|AIDS (Disease) in women|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS|~|World AIDS Campaign|~|Ford Foundation
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Deliver [inscribed]
Description.inscription: ... the urgent need to scale up significantly towards the goal of universal access to comprehensive pervention programmes, treatment, care and support by 2010.|~|Additional poster text: At the beginning of 2008, one-third of peopLe in low and middle income countries needing antiretroviraL treatment and one-third of women requiring drugs to prevent transmission of HIV to their children received them. But to scaLe up towards universaL access to HIV prevention, treatment, care and support by 2010, Leaders must deliver now
Description.note: Descriptive note: Poster emphasizing on universal access for prevention, treatment, care and support for AIDS. Also indicating lack of access to treatments for women and children.|~|Poster shows a hand writing with a red ribbon instead of pen on AIDS|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA020.

Item Title: S'activer [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: World AIDS Day|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control|~|HIV infections--Treatment
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS|~|World AIDS Campaign|~|Ford Foundation
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: S'activer [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Début 2008, seulement un tiers des personnes nécessitant des traitements antirétroviraux dans les pays a revenus faibles ou intermédiaires et seulement un tiers des femmes ayant besoin de médicaments pour empêcher la transmission du VIH a leurs enfants les recevaient. Mais pour atteindre les objectifs d'accès universel a la prévention, au traitement et aux soins fixés pour l'horizon 2010, les dirigeants doivent s'activer maintenant.
Description.note: The poster shows a picture of a hand holding a ribbon like a pen writing the name Ali.|~|Translated additional poster text: In early 2008, only one third of those needing antiretroviral treatment in countries with low or middle income and only one third of women who need to receive medicines to prevent HIV transmission to their children . But to achieve the goals of universal access to prevention, treatment and care set for 2010, leaders must now be activated.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA021.
Alternate Title.translated: Activate

Item Title: Mener [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: World AIDS Day|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS|~|World AIDS Campaign|~|Ford Foundation

Title: Mener [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text:A l‘occasion de la journée mondiale sida, des personnes du monde entier se rassemblent pour mener la riposte contre le sida. Nous avons tous quelque chose d’unique a apportér:s’opposer à la stigmatisation et à la discrimination, s’éduquer sur les modes de prévention contre le VIH, ou s’informer sur les engagements que nos dirigeants ont pris. Notre voix peut faire la différence.Stop SIDA. Tenez la promesse. Pour plus d’informations, consultez le site:www.worldaidscampaign.org
Description.note: Translated additional poster text:On the occasion of World AIDS Day, people around the world gather to carry the response against AIDS. We all have something unique to bring:oppose stigma and discrimination, educate themselves on ways of prevention against HIV, or about the commitments our leaders have made. Our voice can make a difference.Stop AIDS. Keep the Promise. For more information, visit:www.worldaidscampaign.org|~|The poster shows a picture of a group of men and women performing different things, and there are two men climbing on a ladder.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA023.
Alternate Title.translated: Lead

Item Title: Stop Sida. Tenons notre Promesse. [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: World AIDS Day|~|Social advocacy|~|AIDS (Disease)--Social aspects|~|Awareness|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|AIDS (Disease)--Political aspects|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control|~|HIV infections--Social aspects
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Stop Sida. Tenons notre Promesse. [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: Le monde a promis de stopper le SIDA d'ici 2015. Que ferez-vous?L'objectif du Millénaire relatif au SIDA vise à stopper Ia propagation du SIDA et à commencer à inverser Ia tendance d'ici 2015. Pour atteindre cet objectif, des promesses ont été faites et des engagements ont été pris au niveau individuel, communautaire et national. Engagez-vous dans Ia Campagne Mondiale contre le SIDA pour vous assurer que ces promesses sont tenues. Pour plus de détails, rendez-vous sur www.worldaidscampaign.org
Description.note: Translated additional poster text: The world has promised to stop AIDS by 2015. What will you do?The Millennium Development Goal on AIDS is to halt the spread of AIDS and begin to reverse the trend by 2015. To achieve this goal, promises were made and commitments were made at individual, community and national levels. Engage in the Global Campaign against AIDS to ensure that these promises are kept. For details, visit www.worldaidscampaign.org|~|The poster shows a picture of people who are doing a demonstration againt AIDS.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA024.
Alternate Title.translated: Stop Aids. Keep our promise

Item Title: Empower [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Empower [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: The response to AIDS depends on the strength of individuals and communities. To halt the epidemic, it is essential to eliminate the social and economic inequalities and injustices that fuel its spread. Empowering individuals and communities to respond to AIDS is a critical and a fundamental part of respecting and promoting their human rights.|~|Additional poster text: Stop AIDS. keep the promise.
Description.note: Description note: the poster shows the figures of a woman a boy and a girl, which are silhouetted in white on a green background. The children are coloring on paper with red AIDS ribbons.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA025.

Item Title: Responsabiliser [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Social advocacy|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control|~|HIV infections--Social aspects
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Responsabiliser [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: La riposte au sida dépend de la force des individus et des communautés. Pour arrêter l'épidémie, il est essentiel d'éliminer les inégalités et injustices sociales et économiques qui nourissent sa progression. Responsabiliser les individus et les communautés pour faire face au sida est un élément critique et fondamental du respect, de la promotion et de la valorisation de leurs droits humains. Stop SIDA. Tenez la promesse. Pour plus d'informations, consultez le site: www.worldaidscampaign.org.
Description.note: Translated additional poster text: The response to AIDS depends on the strength of individuals and communities. To stop the epidemic, it is essential to eliminate inequalities and social and economic injustices that feed its growth. Empowering individuals and communities to deal with AIDS is a critical and fundamental respect, promotion and enhancement of their human rights. Stop AIDS, keep the promise. To obtain more information, consult the website: www.worldaidscampaign.org.|~|The poster shows a picture of a woman with a boy and a girl, it looks like she is teaching them, both the boy and the girl are writing with an AIDS ribbon on a peice of paper.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item UNA026.
Alternate Title.translated: Empowerment

Item Title: We can work together to help stop the spread of HIV [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Testing|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|HIV-positive persons--Services for|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control

Title: We can work together to help stop the spread of HIV [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text:The PartNer Assistance Program (PNAP) can help you let your sex and needle sharing partners know they may be at risk for HIV. It's important to let your partners know so they can: get an HIV test. get the health care they need. learn how to protect themselves and other from HIV. PNAP is free and confidential! You decide how you want to use the program!PNAP Helps People with HIV
Description.note: Poster shows four images of African-Americans and Caucasians of mixed genders holding conversations in a variety of office settings including one with a medical professional in a medical office.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US080.

Title: They've been hit. With AIDS, too [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: A partner who hits you may insist on having unprotected sex with you. If he has had sex with someone else or if he has shot drugs, he might be putting you at risk for HIV, the virus that causes AIDS; Get help. Call 1-800-942-6906 (English), 1-800-942-6908 (Spanish), 24 hours, 7 days a week, New York State Office for the Prevention of Domestic Violence and New York State Department of Health.
Description.note: Additional poster text: Professional models.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US084.|~|Poster shows five black-and-white photographs of women at different ages and of different races. All women look sad, scared or worried. One of the women is crying. Three others have bruises on their faces. Two of the women hold their kids and look worried probably about the children and their future. Also poster provides telephone number, where abused and infected women can get help.

Item Title: Nada mejor que el pecho a menos que usted tenga el VIH [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: Nada mejor que el pecho a menos que usted tenga el VIH [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Translated poster text: If you are pregnant or plan to have a child, you should be tested for HIV, the AIDS virus. If you are infected, your baby may be born infected ... or contract the infection through your milk.|~|Additional poster text: Si usted está embarazada o piensa tener un hijo, debería someterse a la prueba para detectar el VIH, el virus del SIDA. Si usted está infectada, su bebé podría nacer infectado... o contraer la infección a través de su leche.
Description.note: Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US089.|~|Poster shows four identical pictures of a women breast feeding an infant. The pictures each have a different color hue.
Alternate Title.translated: Nothing better than brestfeeding unless you have HIV

Title: ADAP plus [inscribed]

Item Title: SIDA también las ha golpeado. Pide ayuda [inscribed]
Personal or Corporate Name.publisher: New York (State). Dept. of Health|~|New York (State). $b Office for the Prevention of Domestic Violence
Personal or Corporate Name.repository: Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History and Special Collections for the Sciences
Title: SIDA también las ha golpeado. Pide ayuda [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Translated poster text: If your companion abuses you, surely he will insist on having sexual relations without precautions. If he had sexual contact with another person or has injected drugs, you are exposed to the danger of contracting HIV, the virus causing AIDS. Call... 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Office for the Prevention of Domestic Violence New York State Department of Health and the State of New York.|~|Translated poster text: professional models|~|Additional poster text: Si tu compañero te maltrata, seguramente también insiste en tener relaciones sexuales sin tomar precauciones. Si él tuvo contacto sexual con alguna otra persona o se inyectó drogas, te expone al peligro de contraer el VIH, el virus causante del SIDA.Llama al 1-800-942-6906 (Inglés) 1-800-942-6908 (Español). Las 24 horas del día, los 7 días de la semana. Oficina para la Prevención de la Violencia Doméstica del Estado de Nueva York y Departamento de Salud del Estado de Nueva York.|~|Additional poster text: "Modelos profesionales" and "9265"
Description.note: Poster has 5 black and white photos showing the faces of abused women (some with children) with various ages and ethnicities.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library. History & Special Collections, Collection no. 306, item US093.
Alternate Title.translated: AIDS has also beaten them. Ask for help

Item Title: Edad no lo va a proteger contra el SIDA [inscribed]
Subject.conceptTopic: Sexually Transmitted Diseases--prevention & control|~|AIDS (Disease)--Prevention|~|Sexually transmitted diseases--Prevention|~|AIDS (Disease) in old age|~|HIV infections--Prevention|~|Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome--prevention & control|~|AIDS (Disease)--Information services|~|HIV Infections--prevention & control

Title: Edad no lo va a proteger contra el SIDA [inscribed]
Description.inscription: Additional poster text: 9540 (Spanish) Departamento de Salud del Estado de Nueva York.|~|Additional poster text: Más de 8000 neoyorquinos mayores de 50 años han sido diagnosticados con el SIDA; La prevención del VIH es una responsabilidad para toda la vida; Para obtener más información, llame al: 1-800-233-SIDA; No importa cuántos años tenga, sino lo que haga.
Description.note: Poster depicts head of Spanish woman at her 50-60th. Also poster provides telephone number, where information and other related services can be found. The background color of the poster is lilac.|~|Translated additional poster text: More than 8,000 New Yorkers over 50 years old have been diagnosed with AIDS; HIV prevention is a lifelong job; To learn more, call 1-800-233-SIDA; It's not how old are you -- it's what you do that matters.|~|Translated additional poster text: 9540 (Spanish) New York State Department of Health.|~|There are three other versions of this poster in English: [male] version and two [female] versions.|~|Poster held by Louise M. Alternate Title.translated: Age won't protect you from AIDS
